def: [a] "a father". mā ileh abu 1 "he has no father"; abu mǣli 11, / abūy 16,17,29 "my father". [b] "a male date-palm". in-nabēt min ábu, min il-faḥal 9 "the male palm-flower comes from a male date-palm, from the male".
"Apis florea". From the black and orange bands on the abdomen.

"to bring". atāh nifte 29 "he brought him a bee-colony"; taynēh šē 29 "we brought him a she-goat"; ygi mētinneh 30 "he brings it" lit. "he comes bringing it" act.pt.; yēti laḥam min is-sūq 30 "he brings meat from the shops"; waytyūhe qafīr 29 "and they bring it in a basket"; il-melike wul-ḫādim mā yētin šayy min is-sayḥ 29 "the queen-bee and the drone bring nothing from the desert-plain" 3rd.f.pl.
"slowness". wāḥid kelim bil-ati huwa aḥsan "[when] someone speaks slowly it's better".
ref: [19]; Jb 841 transliterates this bil-lati, taking it as a corruption of the verbal noun of root lʔy, stem viii "to be slow" (H); L 15 atw "a (uniform) way of speaking".

def: [a] v.i. "to harm". yʔaṯṯar ʕalayhe 9,25 "it harms it"; mā yʔaṯṯar fīh 11 "it doesn't harm it". [b] v.t. "to give rise to". ferrāḫa wāḥda tʔaṯṯar mīt rās buṣal 17 "a single flower produces a hundred onion-sets".
"to be late". šayy yetgeddem ušayy yistāḫar 2 "some [palms] are early [to fruit] and some are late".
"last". il-ʕašur il-aḫriyyēt ṣāret il-arbʕīn 1 "the final ten [days] were [the season called] the forty".
"a brother". aḫu mēl-eh 7 "his brother"; aḫūy 12,17 [843] "my brother"; aḫwīk 17 "your brother"; min ḫūtna 29 "[one] of our brothers".
"to punish". wēgid mēdbinneh 12 "he punished [his son] a lot" act.pt.
"to punish". wēgid mēdbinneh 12 "he punished [his son] a lot" act.pt.
"to wreak havoc". ubaʕdayn huwa arraṯ fī Maṣīra, arraṯ yaʕni bil-māy udemmeret Maṣira 1 "and then [the storm] wreaked havoc on Masira, with rain that is, and wrecked it".

[a] "original". sukkǣn Sūr Ugṭayṭ el-azliyyīn 1 "the original inhabitants of Sūr Qṭayṭ"; il-mwāṭinīn il-azil 17 "the original countrymen". [b]* "main", e.g. honey-extraction; type of bee in the hive. dibi azli 29 "Apis mellifera workers"; il-azli 29 [(§ 4.6 example 5)] "the worker-bee".
"a master-craftsman", in leather 9; in iron 15 [(§ 4.5 example 6); in poetry 27.
ref: W ustāḏ "... teacher ..."; S ustād "master ... artisan ..."

def: "slowness". sawwīh bil-asde 1 "do it slowly". = [7]. --- P āste "gently ... slowly".
"a concept". šwǣwi bedu huwa esem wāḥid 12 "šwǣwi is a synonym of bedu".
"to be sure of". yeʔekkid il-makǣn 26 "[the fisherman] knows [his] position [by the stars]". A variant of [1725].

corresponding to W li. With suffixes beginning with a vowel the l can double. [a] "to have". arbʕīn imrīʕi ilhe arbaʕ drūr 1 "mid-winter has four stages". [b]* "to". bagīb illeh moḫal 30 "I bring a sieve to it". [c] object marker 1 [249].

[(§ 6.2)] "if". Often shortened to la 29, lǣ 21 or lā 17 [751]. Sometimes combined with kēn [592]; as is in [1394]. Thus lakēn / lǣkǣn can mean "but if" [1080]; ʕale sitt iyyēm tisqāh dor, bass lǣ kǣn kaṯart, ʕale sebeʕ 21 "give it a watering every six days, but if you give it a lot, every seven". But more often lakēn etc. mean "but" 5 [§ 4.2 example 12]; 11,21.

indeclinable relative pronoun [a] 20 [999a] [§ 6.1] corresponding to W allaḏi which is also used in Khābūra, and for both m. and f. [308]. [b] emphasising the noun or pronoun. kēn il-awwal in-nēs fī aʕmēlhum bass illi 16 "in the old days folk were in their [traditional] occupations and them alone"; bass hiyya illi 12 "that's all it is"; huwwa lli, ḫšimhe huwwa lli 22 "it's the same. Her nose, it's the same [as her snout]".
"a magnet". ḥadīd al-almēs bayiʕšeg el-ḥadīd el-ʕādi 1 "magnetic iron will attract ordinary iron".

ref: P; the original Sanskrit is said to mean an adible arum root, HJ 16.

def: [a] spatial "up to" 1,12,21 [317]; of a letter "addressed to". mislaymēn layn il-mara hǣḏi 17 "from Solomon to this woman".

lex: embe / ambe / hembe, usually defined l-embe, pl. -yǣt 3,9,21

def: "bidding". Mostly in leave-taking formulae, e.g. šayy imāra? 23* "anything else you wish?" [363].
[1554] "a fruiting or suckering female date-palm or other tree.
"an anchor" of stone. il-anyar yiṭbaʕ fil-baḥr 26 "the anchor sinks into the sea".
ref: [360]; R 126 from English (?); Nautical Kuwaiti anyar, anjar "a grapnel", is suggested to have been originally Greek and lanyar a by-form reborrowed from the Persian; L 3013 lanjar "an anchoring places for ships"; H 751 Persian; S langar.

def: "to be well". mitʔēnse 1 act.pt. "healthy", of a well-tended date-palm.

ref: R 193; W "tame"; L 113 + bi "to be happy with".

def: "an inch". teqrīb ink wāḥid 21 "about one inch".
"yes and no", a non-committal answer to a question.
[1577]; [25b] adv. "at first" (W); "formerly, in the old/olden days". fil-awwal 30 "firstly".

"with", humans 12 [842a], 22; animals etc. byē ṯ-ṯor 12 "with the bull"; iḏa kēn byē šaʕīr ... 9 "if [lucerne is sown] with barley ..." 29 used byol- (not mentioned by R), e.g. byolne "with us", and ṭāḥ kill id-dibi byoloh "all the bees fell with him (the šayḫ, i.e. the queen)". bi is of course also used, e.g. il-yom bilayleh 17* "twenty-four hours".
"to dig". awwal yibḥaṯ iṭ-ṭwā bidūn ... 17 "[the Omani] used to dig wells without [metal tools]".
ref: [49]; [51]; Ḥarsūsi beḥāṯ "to make a hole in the ground"; W "... to search ... explore ..."; L 155 "... to search for something in the earth ..."

def: "to sweep". buḥṣ il-bayt bil-ʕaṣu 1 "sweep the house with the dry palm-raceme!"
"a sweet water-well in a wadi-bed near the sea" often very shallow.
ref: [§ 2.4.6 example 39]; Wilkinson 53 says that baḥaṯ, pl. buḥūṯ / baḥāyiṯ is a bedu term for seasonal wells further down wadi-courses.
Jb 877 "warehouse" from Hindi; P buḫārī "... granary".

def: "to understand". [Not known by 7, so probably an inland word.]
"to begin". min biddet ḥawēli ʕišrīn sene 24 "since about twenty years".
ref: [61]; W badaʔa. Stem VIII (e.g. yebtedi 1,11) tallies with W.

def: "to be a hired date-palm-worker". awwal mitbeddar 12 "I used to be a bīdār".
"a basket" about 2ft. across woven from palm-leaves or ġaḍaf [1179]. Also called mizmǣ [687].
"the stage of seedling-lucerne" when the first true leaf appears after the cotyledon-leaves.
"a nose-ring" for a girl/woman, passing through the outside of one nostril.
"gāzra-rope/s", attached to the wayg and mʕalqa.
[a] vi "to form seeds". il-waqt hēḏe ybeḏḏer 21 "at this time [of the year, lucerne] forms seeds". [b] vt 7*,11* "to serve the female", of a goat. = [1509].

[a] vi "to recover". mā bara 1 "it didn't heal". [b] vt "to pierce", denominative from [67]. bass nnuwwaḫah ʕale n-nāqa yibri waḥduh 23 "[a male camel does not need help] we just let him mount the female and he penetrates by himself" (contrary to W. Thesiger, Arabian Sands, Penguin 1977, p.137).
ref: [a] W bariʔa a; L 178 also baraʔa. [b] W abara "to prick, sting", II "to pollinate [a palm-tree]".

def: "a needle; injection". ḍarabha bura 23 "he gave her an injection".
"to become tidy; be clean". ḥette yibraḥ el-bayt bin-naẓāfe, ḥette yibarraḥ el-bayt. 1 "[sweep the house] so it's tidy and clean, so it gets tidied".
"to be cleaned; get tidied", e.g. of a place or a date-palm-cutting.

ref: cf. Nautical Kuwaiti burd "the side or 'borad' of a ship", for which a derivation from Portuguese bordo is given; S parda "... curtain ... walls of a tent ..."

def: [§ 4.4 example 4] "never, not at all". il-barr il-barr batāten 2 "absolutely never"; mā tšūf il-bārra 30 "you never see [it]", a Šarqiyya variant.
"a [traditional] house and courtyard", built from dʕūn [506].
"an animal's hoof", except a camel's which is ḫuff W.
"an upper lip of an animal" as far as the nostrils.
[1042c] barra (W) is also current in Khābūra.
"an old copper baysa-coin". According to 17, named after a ruler of Zanzibar.
ref: W barġaš "gnats" and barāġīṯ "fleas; small silver coins".

def: "to harrow". tbarġaleh bil-ʕaṣu 3 "you harrow it with the dry palm-raceme"; nbarġáluh bil-īdayn 21,25 "we harrow it (lucerne-seed) with [our] hands".

ref: R 41; W barad "hail"; Swahili barafu. [Brockett fails to notice that this is an Iranian borrowing.]

def: "God bless [you]". Often said to someone who has said something that shows understanding.
"abundant". duḫān kaṯīr, brīk 29 "an enormous amount of smoke".
"Divine favour(s)". An often heard comment is that nowadays there is plenty of money, but no abrāk.
"a letter to the qāḍi or wāli" stating a legal complaint.
ref: R 57 "letter"; Jb 826 "(money) cheque"; S parwāna "official written document, e.g. warrant, passport, written precept ..."

def: "dates" in the third of the five stages of ripening. bisra one.

ref: Jb 835 Persian; L 201 I "to break ..."; H Syrian; S bas.

def: [a] vt of people, "to give someone a present" on hearing good news. As you do so, you say ana baššartik, zāyid mʕak ḫayr 17 "here's a gift for you, may things get even better for you"; tbaššir l-awlǣd 11 "you give your first bisr [sic] to [your] sons" (a combination of meanings [a] and [b]). [b] vi of certain plants, e.g. the vine, mango, guava, bīḏām and date-palm, to "bear first-fruits" in summer. awwal baybeššir il-ʕuneb 5 "[in summer] the vine will be the first to start fruiting". The verbal nouns tebšūra 1,11 ... and tibǣšīr 1,3 ... (W "... first signs ...") can refer to any such plant, whereas tibiššera 17,25 appears to be restricted to date-palms. it-tibǣšīr ykūn yaʕni ybeššir il-ešgār 1 "[the time of] tibǣšīr is when trees bear their first-fruits"; but, ybeššir in-naḫīl bit-tibiššera 1 "date-palms bear their first-fruits at tibiššera-time". Hence tibiššera is the name of "the season when the first dates ripen", whether to the bisr stage according to 1, or to the rṭab stage according to 5. ysemma tibiššera ʕale š-šēn inne n-naḫīl yibeššerin 5 "it's called tibiššera because the date-palms bear their first-fruits [then]".
ref: W "... to bring good news to so. ..."

def: "a scar on a man's back" from branding"
"a literate man" consulted when someone falls ill, or is born, etc.
"to be sprawled out". hāyše marīḍa mitbaṣṣaṣa 22* "a sick she-goat lying flat-out".
"a wide wadi-bed; [the] mouth of the Wadi al-Ḥawāsina".

often takes verbal pronominal suffixes, cf. [188]; [545]; [958]; [1093]; R 26. [a] "still" 16 [§ 4.6 example 34]. baʕdakum ... 30 "you're still ..." [b] "more". dris baʕdik 17 "[go and] study more!" [c] + negative, "not yet" 5,7 mā ʕamilteh baʕdni 11* "I haven't fixed it yet". 29 often said baʕdeh for baʕd, e.g. baʕdeh šahr "after a month". The pan-Arabic colloquial baʕdayn "afterwards" is more common than ḫlēf [450].
"to defecate", of animals. [680]; [1619]; W baʕr "... dung".

ref: R 63; L 231 I "... to speak obscurely ..."

def: "[the] first cut of a new lucerne-plant". The second and third are called ṯenu and ṯilṯ, after which there are no special names.
[544] "tomorrow, tomorrow-morning". wara bēkir 2,19*,21* "the day after tomorrow", for which the pan-Arabic baʕd bukra is heard more and more.
ref: W I "to set out early in the morning ..."

def: "a small cane crook" for chiding animals or just carrying under the arm.
"dumb". ma yaʕrif il-ḥaki, bukum 12 "he doesn't know how to speak, he's dumb".
"noisily to want the female", of a he-goat.
= I. batbelled il-māy, kem buld 26 "you plumb the water [to see] how many fathoms".
ref: R 163; L 246 I and II "... to cast oneself down on the ground ..."; denominative from [131]?

def: "a measurement for sea-depth" about a fathom.

lex: beled, pl. bild 23,29 / buldēn 28 / blēd 15,23 / blēdīn 11,30
def: "a village"(W), "a settlement". Beni Ḫālid ḥadr, hel blēdīn [340] 17 "the Beni Ḫālid are settled, inhabitants of villages".

ref: [254]; [701]; Hindi bāltī, from Portuguese balde, HJ 53.

def: "to be very busy", with work or guests.
ref: [568]; Jb 834 ballaš vt "to embroil"; H vt/vi "to undertake sth. (Syrian)".

def: "spiced, kneaded dates" with the stones left in.
"a nose-ring" for a girl/woman, passing through the skin between the nostrils.
"contagious pox", lighter than gidari W, but sometimes fatal.
ref: Swahili mbalanga "a skin disease, especially of the hands, which become covered with light- or dark-coloured patches ..."
[1103]; R 83, 126; P; originally a ring of coloured glass worn on the wrist by women, HJ 60 (cf. [1170]).
[115]; [§ 4.5 examples 7,8]; S bastan, imp. band, "to bind, shut, close up ..."

def: "a large, boundary-marking, earthen dyke, a bund".
ref: L 259 "... dam ... (Persian)"; S; the English bund, a "strike" or "embankment", is also originally from Persian, rather than Sanskrit bandh, HJ 127.

def: "the Khābūra fort" 3; "the market" near the fort 7,17.
ref: W "seaport; commercial centre ..."; S "... emporium, port ..."

R 421 "shotgun"; W bunduqīya, pl. banādiq "rifle, gun"; bunduqa, pl. banādiq "hazlenut, filbert; bullet"; S bundūq "musket"; some say that the word was originally Arabic for "filberts imported from Venice (al-Bunduqiyya)", and then that the name was transferred to the nut-like pellets shot from cross-bows, then to cross-bows themselves, and then to firearms, HJ 127.

def: "to be descended" 17. ane mbennik min flēn 1 "I am of x's lineage", said only by a freeman.
"a trunk" 17; of people, "stock" 17. ane māḫuḏ il-mara hēḏi min flēn, binkha ṭayyib 1 "I took this woman from x in marriage, [so] she's of good stock".
"an inborn trait" 11*,12. bēnikhin ytǣwmin 14 "it's in their genes to bear twins".
[§ 4.6 example 11] a large measure of dry weight, about 40--70 date-sacks' worth.
ref: [572b]; [1215]; [1399]; [1493]; R 399 = 20 frāsle; L 266; P "from Sanskrit"; HJ 47 Sanskrit bhāra "a load".

def: "thick". kalēm ir-rajil bhiš, matīn, kalēm il-mara šwayy wṣayyim 26 "men's speech is thick, full, women's is a little thin".
"not at all". A strong negative, often repeated. ma yġīb ʕalayya bho bho 30 "it never ever remains hidden from me".
ref: Ḥarsūsi 'be-háwʔ' "... never! (not) at all!", 'be' here as a prep.; L 269 bahiya "[the tent] was empty ..."; S baha "far be it!"

def: [a] indeclinable relative pronoun, cf. [25] "which, who(ever)" 12 [1027], 29 [544] mā šayy fīh ʔīdēn bu mā yinḍar 5 "there are no branches on [the stripped vine] that don't leaf". It is often used with il-leḏi, ġayz meʕ bu l-leḏi yiṭlaʕ 12 "the flow of water that rises"; in-nēs l-leḏi bu waṭa fil-ḥāra 17 "the people below in the village". [b] "pertaining to" [§ 4.4 example 6]. [c] n. prefix "possessor of".
[1474a] coll. "camels", as opposed to hoš "sheep and goats".
ref: W "mob, rabble"; L 2907 "a large number of beasts of carriage".
W būq "... treachery ..."; L 276 I; H "to lie".

def: [300] "a pre-Islamic hill-top cairn; beehive-tomb". The local inhabitants are adamant that they are not burial-mounds but look-outs or houses. They are often called bwem gihil "ciarns of [the] Days of Ignorance".
ref: [966[l [1463]; R 15 "entrenchment"; Swahili boma "... earthwork, rampart, fort ..."; S būm "garrison"; The word is probably originally Semitic, cf. Hebrew bāmāh "high place", BDB119. That in the Old Testament such places had a cultic, rather than military, use is indirect evidence that the Omani bwem were burial-mounds.

def: "origin". Only as an adv. with prefix m/im ("from"), and possessive suffixes, "formerly, originally". mbūnhe 6 "originally she ..."; imbūnhin 23 "they (f.) used to ..."; mbūneh [251].

[§ 4.6 example 18] [a] "to want, require". [b] + imp., "to be about to." ... The fuller classical root with medial ġ, is rarely heard in Khābūra, and only in the less common persons like 1st. s. bġayt 6. ġ was not heard with 3rd s. With a noun of place it means "to head for" 2,6. ybā Sagṭara 27 "he's heading for Socotra". It often has an ethic dative, with or without l, ybā luh ... 8,20 "it needs ..."; tebī lhi 8 tebīha 8 "it needs ..."; tawi tbā lha ʕišrīn yom 17 "a well needs twenty days [to dig]". For its use as a future indicator see § 4.3.

ref: R 26 only of slaves (because through Swahili?); S; HJ 78 notes that the presence of the word in Madagascar could hardly be as a loan from Persia or India.
[55]; R 126 from Persian; but S "... awake, attentive".

def: "a tribeless man; vassal". It is a strong insult to call someone such.
ref: R 73 bēsar, pl. beyāsör, "freed slave"; Jb 844 "half-caste"; S bī-sar "headless ..."; P besar "mule".
R 190 tetūn; Jb 847 tutūn "an infant"; Swahili mtoto "anything young or small".
English; Nautical Kuwaiti ṭirbāl "awning", a modern term.

def: "to fill (up)". The verbal noun can be used adverbially, twellefu tars 17 "[the troops] gathered together in a body".
"to burp". min teraʕ gāl al-ḥamd lillāh 1 "someone who burps says, praise be to God".
ref: W "to be full", root krʕ stem V.

def: "a new widow", still within the legal waiting-period of four months and ten days, during which she is not even allowed to see a man. After that she is called armíle.
"to tear", e.g. paper; "to pound" something, e.g. with a stone.

ref: Jb 843 "a matchlock", from Persian; W tufka pl. tufak (Iraq); S tufak/tufang "musket".

def: "to break, get broken". il-imseggel yintilif 7 "the tape-recorder would break [if you dropped it]".

[a] auxiliary verb 12 "to keep on" doing something. temm yiqra 17 "he carried on reading"; ytemmu yṭablu 7 "they go on and on drumming". [b] vi "to remain, last, stay". ytem fiṭ-ṭarīq ṯemēn iyyēm 16 "he's on the road for eight days [to reach Abu Dhabi]"; il-beḏer hēḏe ytemm ḥidaʕšar sena 2 "these seeds will last eleven years"; atemm yomayn maʕakum intu 30 "I'll stay a couple of days with you".
[a] 11 "a metal cylinder", e.g. for Calor gas. = [1264]. [b] *30 "tin", material and container.
ref: [b] [1334]; [1346]; R 42 material; Jb 873 through Hindi from English (but absent from P); W "tin-plate", tanaka "tin-container"; HJ 898 tank "a reservoir ...", of dual origin, Indian and European.

def: "to bear twins". mā šayy minhin ytawmin 22 "none of [our goats] have twins".
[741]; [337] "now, recently" (not so immediate as W). layn taww 5 "up till now. It can take verbal pronominal suffixes, tawwhē zēhi 29 "it's flowering now".
"a vessel" for cooking over a fire.
=+ ʕind "to be someone's proof". hēḏe r-raṣīd yiṯbit ʕinduk 11 "this receipt is your proof".
ref: L 328 "... to become established fact with so. ..."

def: "[the] third cut of a new lucerne-plant".
"Tuesday". A variant of yom iṯ-ṯilǣṯe, W.
"a mouth". iz-zūʕ miṯ-ṯem 12 "vomit comes out of the mouth". But 29 said fim, W.
"a flower". il-kīfe el-leḏi ṭalaʕat minhe ṯ-ṯemra 1 "the date-palm-spathe out of which rises the [male] flower". The pan-Arabic meaning "fruit" W, is also used.
"to go back". A bedu word according to 17; not known by 7.

"two" with f. noun 6 [1394], 5 [§ 4.6 example 8]; 12 sēʕa hintayn 15 "at two o'clock". ṯnayne with m. noun. nefer ṯnayne ysidduh 6 "two men are enough for it"; iṯnayne 12,20 "two men"; iṯnayne šahr 15 "two months".
"[the] second cut of a new lucerne-plant".
"a palm-leaf/ġaḍaf basket" for donkey-loads, e.g. of dung. Larger than a sack.
[a] "to stand up", not suddenly 22*,30. yom tʕaqilha mā trūm tṯūr 23 "when you put the ʕiqāl on her (a camel), she can't stand up".
ref: [a] [1113]. [b] W "... to swirl up, raise (dust) ...", fāra u "to boil ... well forth ..."

def: "to boil". yṯawwar fog in-nār 9 "it boils on the fire".
"the star Gāh", the zodiac sign Cancer, rising in the north opposite Canopus.
ref: Swahili jaa "compass point north"; An Historical Atlas of Islam, ed. W.C.Brice, London 1981, pp. 2,3 "al-djāh - α of Ursa Minor" (i.e. Polaris, the Pole-star). Known more usually to the astronomers as "al-jady", L 393.

def: "a north-wind", i.e. from the direction of [208].
"rock, rocky ground". arḍ il-Bāṭna mā fīhe gebel 20 "Bāṭina-soil isn't rocky".

ref: R 4 gṯīl; W jaṯl "thick, dense (especially hair)".

def: [§ 6 example 15] "an unglazed, spheroid water-pot" suspended from its neck, allowing some water to seep through and evaporate and so cool the remainder inside.
[§ 4.6 example 4]; [§ 4.6 example 6]; [1626]; [§ 4.5 example 12] "to harvest the whole raceme of dates (ʕiḏq)" by cutting its stalk (ʕasqa). Passive geded [§ 4.6 example 18]; yedd [§ 4.2 example 10].
ref: L 384 "... to cut off the fruit of palm trees ..."

def: only of women, "to wash before prayer". al-mara atgeddid 26; tegeddedin in-nisē 7; it-tgedded 26 "women's ritual ablutions". twaḍḍa W is only of men.
ref: R 108 seemingly also of men; W "... to be renewed ..."

def: "an oar-shaped heel (pulvinus)" of a cut-off palm-branch.

ref: [1125]; R 256 [in the pl. gdāle]; Jb 818; EADS114m Qaṭari jidal "flying fox"; H ajdal "a kind of hawk"; P gadal "flying fox" from Urdu.

def: of a plant, "to take" 15,25. min tigḏib iṣ-ṣarme ... 1 "once the palm-cutting has taken ..."
"a sack" woven from palm-leaves, containing suḥḥ / temr. Without contents it is called ḫṣāfe [428] or kse [1369].

"wounded" (W). arbʕīn yerīḥ, arbʕīn testerīḥ, arbʕīn tšimmin il-māy wer-rīḥ 1,19* a jingle about the cycle of the female date-palm "for forty days wounded (s.) [from cropping, gedēd], for forty days resting (s.) [with the ḥīb [283] inside], for forty days smelling (pl.) water and wind [with the ḥīb emerging to become kīfēt]".

ref: [1444]; Donaldson "beach-seine"; Swahili jarife; W mijraf "shovel, scoop"; L 412 adj. "greedy ..."

def: "[the] inside front throat", of animals and humans.
ref: W jirān "the front part of a camel's neck".

def: "a large cart", e.g. for a donkey.
ref: [1079]; R 62; P gāṛī; the English "gharry" is also from Hindi, HJ 365.

def: "to draw water by ox". baʕd hēḏayle ygizru 1 "after those [hours of rest] they [start] drawing".

"the ox-walk-well", according to 12 more correctly iz-zāgira [659]. Akin to the Iraqi bakra. The bull(s) was/were led down an excavated incline and so raised the leather bucket (delu) by ropes. Since this system has been replaced by diesel-pumps Omani agriculture has changed radically.
"sweet potatoes", also called findēl and ḥašu.
"to cut" mature lucerne or grain, but not grass, with a gēzz, while grasping the stalks with the other hand.
ref: W "to cut off ...", especially the wool of sheep.

def: "to be cut". kēn huwa ṣaġīr mā inyezz, lēzim tʕaṣfeh bil-myezz 2 "if [the lucerne] is young it doesn't get cut. You must slash it with the cutter".
"a cut" of lucerne. min ykemmel ṯlēṯ gezzēt lēzim guṣṣ ir-rummēn šwayy šwayy šwayy 9 "once it has completed three cuts [you] must slice into the crowns a little more each time".
"a wooden-handled tool" for cutting lucerne or grain, with a single, slightly curved, serrated, metal blade about ten inches long.
"to pass by". A bedu word according to 17; not known by 7.

ref: L 426 jašib "... coarse (food)"; H i "to be hardened (of mud)".

def: "a large black ant; a man's name".

only of God, "to ordain". allah taʕǣle byigʕal in-naym hēḏi yinzil fil-baḥr 1 "God ordains that this star (šelli) sets over the sea"; yerʕa, allah gaʕal illeh, fil-layl 1 "[the hedgehog] forages, as God has ordained for him, by night".

ref: W jufra "pit, hole"; L 433 jafr "... an uncased well ..."

def: "a period" of time. hēḏe s-suḥḥ mbūneh ilē gil ḥol ma yḍīʕ 6 "in the old days dried dates didn't go off [even] for the length of a whole year".
ref: W ilā ajalin ... "... for a period ..."

lex: yelbe 2,3,6 / gelba 17,20,25, pl. yillēb 2,6 / jillǣb 8,11,17 {(§ 4.4 example 11)}; / yelbēt 2,5
def: "an irrigation-plot", seldom larger than 100 x 20 ft., bounded by low bunds, wʕūb.
ref: L 440 julba "... a detached portion of herbage ..."

def: "I sat down"; gessayt ana maʕ Darwīš 30 "I sat down with Darwīš"; gis! 30 "sit down!"; gāssīn 11 act.pt. "they were sitting".

ref: [133]; [701]; English, but probably through Hindi gilās (P, HJ xxi) "glass ... mug", because it is not a new borrowing.

def: "a gāzra-rope or block" joining the kurr to the rišé 12. But 17 used it as a collective term for the kurr, bdēnēt, rišé and mʕalláqa, i.e. "tackle".
ref: Nautical Kuwaiti yāmiʕa "tye-block or ramhead, i.e. the upper block of the halyard tackle which is fastened to the tye"; W "... collector ..."

def: "a confederation". gǣmiʕa l-Hināwiyya 17 "the Hināwi super-tribal grouping".
similar to W, but there is a clear distinction between [a] + def. art. el-gimǣʕa "the clan, everyone" and [b] + possessive suffix, 17 [§ 4.1 example 6] "the immediate family".
"a stamped-down circular area of ground", for threshing grain on with a flail, midwās [540].
"nature". gēnis il-burtuġāl ḥārr 30 "the nature of oranges is hot". Not a lengthening of gins W, which he also used. = 261.

ref: R 134 ghid; W vt "... to fatigue ..."; L 473 vt "(of a disease) to affect so. severely ..."

def: "about, approximately". gob mītayn rās 23 "about two hundred head [of goats]". 30 often used it with qadar "amount", [§ 4.6 example 14].
ref: R 104 min gob "like"; Ḥarsūsi gōbi "edge, limit of an enclosure"; W jaub "traversing ..."; L 480 jawb "... kind, sort".

def: "a small mountain-cave", such as Apis florea nest in.
ref: W ġār; H jūra, pl. juwar "hollow ... gap" (Syrian).

def: "a check, water-diverter". A mountain word for miradd [588].
ref: [780]; W jāla "... to be circulated ..."; L 589 "... piece of rock at the bottom of the water supporting the well-casing ..."
[461]; P gon/gonī; the English "gunny" is also from Hindi, HJ 403.

def: [376b] "to bring". gube 8 [§ 4.2 example 1] 1st. pl. pf.; ygēb 12 [§ 4.2 example 4] "are brought"; megyūb 7* pass.pt.
ref: Pan-Arabic colloquial for jāʔa bi (W), but not a modern loan, Jb 837.

def: "a shallow, round irrigation-basin", for a mature date-palm. dimm rāba, sawwa trāb, baʕdayn stawa gīl, ʕād kebīr ʕād 15 "fill in [the] hole for the palm-cutting, put on earth, then it becomes a gīl [because the palm] has already become mature".
ref: [478] [579]; [§ 4.6.2.2; L 489 "... the surround parts of sth."

def: "one piece", of fruit or anything small.
"sir, master". A ḫādim respectfully addresses as šayḫ "yā ḥbǣbi" or "yā ḥbǣbuh", meaning yā mawlāy, 7,17.
"a date" in the first of the five stages of ripening. The other stages are ḫalēl, bisr, qārīn, rṭab / qayẓ.
"a padded rope-harness", slung round the palm-trunk in order to climb it.
"to drop; droop", of leaves. yom yḥitt liḥāḥ is-Sidr 23 "when the Sidr-leaves fall". This verb is distinct from ḥaṭṭ "to put down" W.
ref: R "to fall", 236 of a human, 260 of a thing; L 508 "... to fall (of leaves) ..."

def: "[the] innermost formation of the datepalm-flower", also called il-libb, W "... the heart ..." ḥībe 1 one.

ref: R 89; W I "... to detain ...", II "to petrify ..."

def: "to be delayed, detained". iḏa nezzel wēgid taḥat yetḥaggar fin-naqād 20 "if [the lucerne-seed] goes down very deep it's late in sprouting"; dem mitḥaggar, mʕtuqid dāḫil 1 "detained bleeding, clotted internally [in the cheeks]".
"a dry-cell battery", often used in shops as weights for scales.
[a] vt 2 "to go round". yḥīlinhe ṯīrān 1 "bulls go round and round [the sugar-press]". [b] vi 1 "to have a churning stomach-ache".

[a] 1,7 "a metal collar" joining the blade of a tool to its wooden handle, as with the misḥā [727], kraz [1361], hibbiyya [1601] and mḥašše W. [b] 1,2 by synechdoche, "a mḥašše" itself, a tool for cutting grass (ḥašīš) and grain. [c] 1 "churning pains in the stomach". Verbal noun of I.
[a] 7* "a child's anklet". [b] 1,20 an old Khābūran word for "[the] metal collar" joining the wooden spoke from the bull to the sugar-press.
ref: [a] [1556]; W ḥaǧl / ḥiǧl; Ḥarsūsi ḥeyōleh, pl. ḥewāyel "[iron] ankle-ring, bracelet".

def: [§ 6.5] "one, someone". ḥad minhum 19* "one of them"; kull ḥad 12,24.29 [376a] "everyone"; maʕ ḥad dūn ḥad, mā maʕ killhum 29 "not everyone has [the gift of bee-keeping], one man has, another hasn't"; ma ḥad 6,17 [681] "no one".
indeclinable adj., of soil "previously uncultivated". arḍ ḥadaṯ 2,25.
"to challenge". yḥidduh, ḥiddit hēḏēk el-faqīh 17 "she challenges, challenged the theologian".

[§ 4.6 example 4] il-ḥidār 1,11,17 "to lower the young ʕuḏūq (date-racemes) and tie them on to zor (leaf midribs)", mainly for stability, but also to facilitate later picking (ḫarāf). ḥidār is done forty days after tenbīt (pollination), and the fresh dates, qayẓ, appear forty-days after ḥidār.

"straight down; below". ṭāḥ ḥadar 11* "[the fruit] fell straight down"; il-māy yī min ḥadar 4 "the water comes from below". 1 said it was an Arabic loan-word from further up the Gulf, the Omani word being tḥat.
[a] 1,17* [1587] adv. "seawards". Synonym of wata [1709], and antonym of sēnid [774], ʕalwe [1119]. [b] 24 n. "a camel's upper neck and head".

ref: R 62 ḥaḏūr "careful"; W ḥaḏira "... to be wary ..."

def: "battles". sawwu hāḏe l-bwem minšēn ḥarābe, miṯil ṣyeb 24 "they made these cairns for battles, like look-outs".

ref: R 205 + ʕale, of a dog "to growl at".

def: "sorghum". So-called because it is planted in high summer. It is of two types, ḥmayra "red" and bwayḍa "white", both called zaybar by 29.
"to wait for". aḥriṣuh 7 "I'll wait for him".
"a house/garden-boundary". ḥaram bayt yaʕni ḥawiz mēl bayt 12 "the ḥaram of a house is the same as its ḥawiz"; il-ḥaram bayni ana ubayn Ḥamad 17 "the boundary between me and Ḥamad".
"to contain". hiyye l-leḏi ḥāzze l-adwiye l-leḏi yḫallūhe fīhe 1 "[the mortar, il-minḥǣz [1514]] is what contains the drugs they leave in it". A variant of [367].
of irrigation-water in a ḫabīl [397], "to reach half-way up the side".
"to reach". minhayn mḥuzzuq il-māy 21 "[you plant tomatoes] where the water came to".
"to put on a belt". tḥazzaq bil-ḫangar 17 "he put on his belt and dagger". A bedu word according to 17.

ref: R 73; W ḥizām; L 560 "anything with which one ties, binds or makes fast".

def: =+ ʕale "to call someone to account for something". tḥǣsib ʕalayya šayy willa šayy? 22 "anything else I can do?", said on departure, lit. "do you call me to account for anything?".
A mountain word for "sweet potatoes". Because the foliage spreads along the ground? [317].
"to spread along the ground". byiḥši layn hina 21 "[the water-melon-plant] will spread up to here".

[1323] of female palm-flowers, "to develop into fruit properly", by being given the correct amount of ʕaṭīl [1106]. in naḫla hēḏe mā ḥaṣdit 25 "[the flowers of] this palm have developed badly (pollination was incorrect)".
ref: [423]; W aḥṣada "to be ripe"; L 581 "... (of a rope) to become firmly made ..."

def: ḥāṣul inšallah 1 "it will be done, D.V." A polite answer to a request from a superior. Past optative.
"stuck", e.g. of a goat in a narrow gap, "unable to get down from a height", "wanted" by the police, "in difficulties".
of bedu, "to spend the months of qayẓ (ripe dates) near a settlement with palm-gardens". binḥaḍar Mḍaybi 27 "we'll spend the ripe-date-season outside Mḍaybi".
"the collection of palm-frond-huts on a settlement's edge", inhabited by the bedu during ḥuḍūr.
ref: W "... metropolis ..."; L 590 "... a company of men staying in their place of assembling ..."

def: [a] "a serious bite", from a camel or donkey. [b] "paralysis". = [332].

ref: L 594 ḥaṭam "a disease in the legs of a beast".

def: "a binding" for castrating an animal. After a week or so the scrotum is cut off with a knife or red-hot branding iron.

[a] 7 "a bridal dower". = muhr W, ṣadāq W. [b] "a legal right" W, as in the wording of the ṯibēt [195], written by the qādi on the settlement of a case, lē buga ḥagg we lē daʕwa, flēn bin flēn tnēzel ʕan ḥaggíteh 11 "No right or plea remains, x has relinquished his claim". This receipt is kept by the payer as proof against further claims by the payee. [c] prep. "for, to". minfaʕah ḥagg iḍ-ḍaww 10 "[kereb] is useful for [fuel for] fire"; arḍ el-Bāṭna aḥsan ḥaqq zrāʕat el-lūmi 20 "Bātina-soil is better for growing lime-trees"; tidfaʕ inte min gaybuk ḥagg il-ʕāmil 9 "[these days] you end up paying out of your pocket to the hired [palm-]labourer [rather than out of any profits]". It corresponds to some of the meanings of ḥāl and mǣl.
[947],[16] "to talk, have a conversation". min tḥakkayna taww ... 22 "in the time that we've been talking now [we could have got there]".
"round about". rʕāt il-blēdīn ḥallēq inḥin 30 "the people of the villages round about us".

ref: [1409]; [1425]; EADS 126 ḥliča; W ḥalika "to be pitch-black ..."; L 631 ḥulaklik adj. "intensely black"; H ḥulka "species of lizard".

def: [a] 7 "an instalment of a debt". [b] 7,17 "oil" made from desert-shrubs, used on the hair. [c] 7,17 "oil" made from desert-shrubs, used internally for stomach-ache, often called ḥell ḥelīl.
ref: [a] Jb 847 ḥilla; W "... discharge ..." [b] R 416; Nautical Kuwaiti ḥall "sesame oil for caulking-cotton"; W "... solution ..."; L 621 "oil of sesame". [c] R 184 ḥulūl "laxative".

def: "a large earthenware pot" with a wide mouth, for storing suḥḥ.
ref: [410]; L 621 ḥalla "large basket for wheat (Baghdad); copper cooking-pot (Egypt)" (W).

def: [a] 7,17 "a small settlement". [b] bil-ḥilla! 14*,25* "forgiven!, granted!", the answer to sēmiḥni! "excuse me!" = masmūḥ!
"possession(s)". hēḏēk ḥalēli 12 "that [garden] of mine"; kill ḥad yaʕraf ḥalēluh 24 "everyone knows his own [camels]".
"an earthenware pot" for water, made by women.
"sweetness". min zod ḥelēteh 6 "because of [the dates'] extreme sweetness".
"to buy fish" for a day's meals. Denominative from ḥle [350]. awwal neferayn baytḥallu biʕašr baysēt 12 "in the old days two men would buy [a day's] fish for ten baysa".
"fish" ṣ-ṣayd ysammyūh ḥle 12 "ṣayd andḥle are synonyms".
"to become brown". ilayn yeḥmarr 14 "[cook the meat] until it browns". This word and [434] have definitely not come from any literary influence, cf. EADS45.
ref: R 176; W "to turn red ..."; II vt "... to brown".

def: "brown", e.g. of Arabs' skin, or of a goat's coat.
"to cook" food. aḥimseh yaʕni aqallīh 7 "cook [the meat]".
ref: W "... to be ardent ..."; H "to fry (meat)".
W "to consider so. stupid ..."; H "to act like a fool".

def: "to take". yistaḥmil arbʕīn yom 25 "[lucerne-flowers] take forty days [to become ripe seeds]".
ref: R 30 "to put up with" (= W VIII).

def: "a load" of threshed corn, called ḥumūla (W) by 8.
of water, "to swirl up and become cloudy".

W "... need ... desire ... thing ...", as in polite leave-taking, ḥāge imāra? 9*, / ḥāge šayy? 22 "anything else [I can do]?" pl. aḥwāy 11* mā yiftihim aḥwāy sukkēnhe 1. "he doesn't understand the needs of its people".
Inland, this means "[the] housing-area of a settlement", as distinct from the palm-gardens. On the coast, where the palm-gardens are also inhabited, it means "[the] seaside housing- and market-area".
"to mark out land" before or after buying.
"to contain". ḥāwizhe ʕan ṭṭīḥ 1 "[the mortar] is what held [the drugs] from falling out".

ref: Jb 850 "limit"; L 668 "... property surrounded by a dam ..."; H "fenced place".
W I "to round up ...", II "to gather something".
[1636]; W tahwīš [sic]; L 668 "trying to turn someone ... inciting ..."

def: of a male animal, "to serve". il-kebš yḥīšhin 13* "the ram impregnates [the ewes]".
ref: L 668 "to chase game towards the snare".

def: of a female animal, "to be [successfully] served". iḥtǣšet il-gaʕde 11* "the ewe is now pregnant".

[a] possession, "belonging to, for" 29 [1218] ... hēḏe ḥālik 17 "this is yours"; ir-ramm ḫuṣūṣi, mā ḥǣl kull ḥad 12 "ground called ramm is private, not common property"; ... ḥǣl ḥaywǣnǣt 8 "[we use burnt palm-thorns as food] for animals"; ḥālak šayy? 19* "do I owe you any more money?" [b] direction, "to" 1 ... gībuh ḥāli 17 "bring it to me"; yiṭlaʕ min dāḫil ḥa barra 1 "he goes outside"; mimkēn ḥamkēn 27,30 "from place to place". [c] second object marker, "to" 9 ... allah tʕǣle msaḫḫarinhin ḥālhe 12 "God made [the worker-bees] subservient to [the queen]"; iḏe ʕamelt ḥal-gūl maʕrūf byiṭlaʕ 16 "if you're kind to the snake, it'll come out". [d] ḥa as a verbal prefix indicating the future or volition is a bedu feature uncommon in Khābūra, where b- is usual.
"[the] cycle or duration of a year". sena is more just a measure of time. ʕale l-ḥol 9 "annually"; ḥol sena 19 "a whole year".
ref: R 87; W "year ...", I "... to go by (time) ..."

def: of plants, animals, humans, "one year old", hence "established".
"beside, up to". inte ḥayt ana asīr 30 "you beside me, [as] I go along; mā trūm tūṣal ḥaytīna 30 "you can't get up to where we are"; ḥayt zayn ṣār 30 "it has become fairly good".
"to know". ma ndell hayš uma ḥad mo 17 "he had no idea at all", lit. "he didn't know what" (twice). = [516].
[a] 1,17 "to braid" a rope, by rubbing palm-fibre between the palms of the hands. [b] 7,12* "to tighten", e.g. a screw.
"a narrow, gold or silver finger-ring" without a stone or widened part.
"to swarm up into the air", of bees.
el-ḥīne 1 (§ 4.6 example 20),6 [681], 8 ... "now; nowadays". el-ḥīn W 6,11*,13* ... is more common
v.i./v.t. of God, "to give life". As in variants of the common greeting ḥayyāk allāh (W II), yā ḥayyallah 5, / yā ḥayybuk (ullāh) 1,23*
"any [at all], whichever". ḥayyallah simēd, kulluh wāḥid 21 "any fertiliser you like, it makes no difference".
"a vagina", e.g. of a goat. Probably from the root-meaning "life", rather than "shame", cf. [1574].
"a dug-out ox-walk", sloping down from the gāzra-derrick, and down which the man takes the bull(s) thus raising the bucket.
ref: [1000]; [1507]; W ḫabba "to amble (animal) ..."; L 692 ḫubb "... depressed land", 706 ḫabb "... deep trench in the ground ..."

def: "to greet someone", verbally and/or by contact. il-ḫibār/il-imḫābra 7,17* "words or actions of greeting".
ref: R 164 "to offer the hand in greeting"; W mainly written communication.

def: "to pierce", e.g. ears, concrete blocks. maḫbūg 1 pass. pt.

= I. ṭābūg mḫabbag 1,9*,11* ... "large cement bricks" with two square holes through which, in construction, pass steel rods (asyāḫ) and later, concrete in-fill. Solid bricks are smaller and called ṭābūg mʕabbe (W "filled") or more usually ṭābūg ʕādi (W "ordinary").
"a wide irrigation-channel" in which plants are grown. il-guḥḥ baʕduh yrīd ḫublēn, bayn ḫabīl uḫabīl ṯlēṯe amtār 21 "watermelons also need [to be grown in] ḫublēn, three metres apart".
"a clay-lined tank", for collecting the sugar pressed from canes by bulls rotating round a press.
[a] 7*,17*,19* ... "[a descendant of] a black slave". [b] 16*,25*,29 (§ 4.6 example 5) ... "a drone-bee", because of its colour.
"impotent", of a male-palm 1,2; of a he-goat 1.
"to take". ḫaḏḏayt 6 "I took"; ḫaḏ! 17 "take!"; māḫuḏ 1 [148],9 act.pt.; māḫūḏ 29 (§ 4.6 example 27) pass.pt.

ref: [457]; Wilkinson 57 a bedu word for "contaminated", of water.

def: "to soak", e.g. dried beans before cooking them.

[a] 9 "an earthenware pot" for storing suḥḥ, smaller than a ḥill [344]. [b] 30 "a small mountain-pool". [c] 6,13*,20 ḫars ḫšeb "a three-foot-tall earthenware pot", for storing suḥḥ, despite being termed 'wooden'.
"to climb the palm and pick fresh dates", enough for a day or two.

ref: [947]; W ḫarifa "... to drivel ...", ḫurāfa "... fairy tale".

def: "to perforate". mḫarrag 1 "having gaps", e.g. of a wickerwork manfaḍ [1575].
of bees, "to abscond". yuḫzif hina uyuḫzif hinēk bis-sawa 29 "they swarm here at the same time as they do over there".
"to mess/mix up". layš ḫasfit beh? 7 "why did you mess [the pile of papers] up?" ḫsifni hēḏe l-awrāg! 1 "shuffle these cards for me!"
a general term for "a boat". la-ḫšibe 3 "the boat".
[a] "to go into" (W). [b] "to put into". Both [a] and [b] are uncommon variants of dišš [502].
"to be inside". fili-gibēl mitḫaššišēt 29 "[the wild Apis mellifera] are in under the cliffs".
"dried-up dead flowers of a female palm" a month or so after pollination, as a result of being given too few or too many ʕaṭīl.
[a] v.i. 20*,26* "to tumble, cave in". il-ḫšēfa 17. [b] v.t. "to break, smash". il-ḫašf 17. yiḫšif gebel bil-hīb 17 "he breaks rock with the pinch".
= I [a]. ʕan yinḫišif 12 "to stop it caving in".
[a] verbal noun of I [b]. [b] 1,13*,18* "a boy's small earring" with tiny spheres on it.
ref: [484]; Śḥeri ḫśfét "a hole bored in the ear".

lex: ḫṣāfe 1,8,15 (§ 4.5 example 1) ..., pl. ḫasaf 9,11 / ḫṣaf 6,8,12 (§ 4.2 example 4) ...
def: "an empty sack" woven from palm-leaves, for suḥḥ = [1369].
ref: [227]; W ḫaṣfa, pl. ḫiṣāf "basket (made of palm-leaves)".

def: [a] 24 [777]. = [432]. [b] coll. "geldings". kulluh faḥal, mā fīh ḫṣiyya 24 "they're all stallion[-camels], none are geldings".
"to become green" (W). is-sene zayne bil-matar wuḫḍarr id-dunya šwayy 12 "this year has been good for rain and everything has got a bit greener".
"... mind; desire ..." (W), as in polite leave-taking šayy fḫāṭrak? 1 / šayy ḫāṭrak? 22 "anything else I can do (lit. on your mind / you want)?"

ref: Jb 864 "small saw"; W ḫaṭṭa "to draw a line ... carve ..."

def: [a] v.t. 17,29 "to go along". iḏa ḫāṭif ṭarīq mā bizqúruh tʕāl 16 "if he's going along a road I wouldn't call out to him, 'Come over here!'" [b] v.i. 17 [789b] "to fly/rush off".
ref: [b] R 112; L 765 "... to go along quickly ..."

def: "to cut off kereb ([1358]) and fibre (līf, W) from the date-palm-trunk" during rubuʕ. passive, § 4.2 examples 8,13.
ref: [825]; [1289a]; W "to seize with the claws"; L 782 "... to cut (herbage) ..."

def: "the man who cuts off kereb and līf".
"a curved, unserrated metal-bladed tool" used for ḫlēbe, the blade being more than a foot long.
ref: [241]; [500]; W "... talon"; L 782 "... a reaping-hook without teeth".
[1553]; [1582]; W ṭalaʕa; H IV "to send forth leaves ..."

def: "to conflict (with)", W. Most often heard in the phrase mā yḫālif 11,16,17 ... "it doesn't matter", similar to mā yhimmak (W) "don't let it worry you" and mā ʕalayh, lit. "not on it". The verbal noun can be stronger in meaning than W muḫālafa, daragu ʕale l-Ḥwāsna mʕind mḫālifēt 17 "they attached themselves to the Ḥawāsina tribe in times of [tribal] wars".
"a length of material", e.g. before being made into a wizār.
"a plain round earring" for a girl or woman, larger than durur [484].
"to soak". arīd aḫalluh fil-māy minšǣn yuġdi layyin 17 "I want to soak [the grain] in water so that it becomes soft".
"dates" in the second of the five stages of ripening, green but edible. ḫalēle one.
"the end of winter", when the dates are at the ḫalēl stage. The time to sow lucerne.

ref: [406]; Wilkinson 57 a bedu word; S ḫwur-āb "impure water ...", šor "... brackish ..."

def: [a] v.i. 2,11 [1428b],15 ... "to move out of the way". [b] v.t. 7,8 "to take something away". ḫūzeh! 5 "pull [the vine-leaf] off [the branch]!"; passive, § 4.2 example 2.
"no problem!", "don't worry!". The W meaning, "fear", is greatly attenuated here.
"to stink". ḫāyis 11*,13* act.pt., of a dead animal.
"[the] roof" of the main part of a barasti-house [85], triangular in cross-section like a small tent.
[a] 11* "a car-boot". [b] 7 "a plastic water-container", holding at least a gallon.
ref: [b] R 400 "tin container; L 841 "... receptacle, from Persian ..."; S "Arabic borrowing"; P dabba "leathern bottle for oil, etc."

def: "to scurry", of an ant or fly.
indeclinable adj. of a Landrover etc., "four-wheel-drive".
"a plain finger-ring", explained as "double" the thickness of [384].
[a] 29,30 "a large hornet" with yellow and brown stripes, a robber of bee-hives. [b] 28,39 coll. "Apis mellifera workers".
[a] 12 [§ 4.6 example 39], 14 "a shallow well over an aquifer". [b] 16,17 "an aquifer" itself. When a well has abundant water, you say degla taḥat 16.
ref: [b] W "the Tigris"; L 853 I "... to transfer the bucket from the well to the watering-trough ..."

def: "pus or a stye" in the eye.
ref: R 49 "a reopened wound"; W dāḥis "whitlow, felon"; H "whitlow".

def: "to pierce", e.g. a blister with a needle, "make a hole in".
of small things, "to sink". it-trāb daḥan fil-qāʕ uġada l-māy ṣāfi 17 "the dirt sank to the bottom and the water became clear".
"a deep irrigation-pit" for a palm cutting (ṣarma). The Bāṭina-word for [579].
ref: [276]; L 857 udḥīy / udḥiyya, pl. adāḥin "place in the sand where an ostrich lays its eggs".

def: "to gush", of water 5,17 (§ 4.4 example 2, where the verbal noun is used as an absolute object for emphasis); "to gabble", of a person 17; "to tumble down", of a house or rocks 17.
ref: W dardara "... a rush (of water) ... chatter".

def: [§ 6.11] "a season; period". It can refer to the four seasons of the year, darr iš-šte etc., and also to shorter periods within each season, cf. [23].
"a girl's plain earring", smaller than a ḫalqa [452].

ref: [a] R 402. [b] Jb 838 from Persian; S darš "stable, stall ..."

def: "a layer", of a vine 16*,20; "a stolon", of grass 17*.
[a] 7,17 "to hurry someone up". [b] to grab someone". derekteh 1 "I grabbed him".
ref: W III, IV "... to catch someone ..."

def: [a] 1 [1318] "[the] noose" of a two-stranded rope, fitting over a toggle on a daʕn-door, to keep it shut. [b] 17 "a headband", in olden days.
ref: [877]; Nautical Kuwaiti darka "any becket or loop for securing the end of a runner or tackle, often by means of a toggle ..."; L 874 "the ring of the bow-string that falls into the notch of the bow ..."

def: [a] v.t. 5*,17 (§ 4.6 example 35) ... "to know" (W). Only heard in 1st s. imp. negative, madri kem nefer 19 "I don't know how many people". [b] v.i. "to wake up". dra! 17 "wake up!"
[a] "to inform". [b] "to awaken someone". adarrīk yaʕni aqayyimak min in-nom 17 "adarrīk means I awaken you from sleep".

=+ ʕale [a] 7,17 "to look after, take care of something". [b] 17 often with wagh, "to avoid; be reserved", lit. "to save face". dāri ʕale wayhuk! 7 to a child, "keep away!" or "keep your reserve!"; el-bint imdārya 7,17 act.pt. "the girl is shy".
ref: [a] W v.t. "to hide something". [b] Jb 816 "to be ashamed".

def: "a copper bowl", three to four feet in diameter, used specifically for cooking ḥalwa.
"a small maḫlab" ([443]) used for removing thorns from palm-leaves, slashing new lucerne [1100], etc.

"a long shirt", worn over the wizār by men off their own land. It is similar to the Saʕūdi ṯawb, but with a tassel ([1213]) and only one button. The first š is often pronounced h, dihdǣštuh 17, cf. EADS 20 n.1
[a] 1,7,17 ... "to enter" a place. Also used intransitively with ʕind or ile, mā ydišš ileh l-māy 9 "water won't get into it". [b] "to make something enter". dišš is-sayyāra! 12 "drive the car in!"

ref: L 903 al-mudliǧ; H "... rambling at random ... darkness ..."

def: "to collide (with)", of a car 7,17; or person. daʕamteh 11 "I bumped into it".
"sheeting", made from mid-ribs of palm-leaves tied ([678a]) into lengths and used for housing ([85]), drying dates on (§ 4.6 example 12), etc. daʕne [1428c] one such length.
"to put down; leave". awwan daʕayna š-šumʕ fī ṭabil 28 "first we put the comb in a hive"; dʕīh! "put it down!" 30 "leave it!" 11 = brāyeh [562].
"to hurt someone in the eye", given as a bedu variant of waġaf [1713].
"a compacted earthen brim" of a gelbe or irrigation-channel. An inland word for ʕurm or waʕb.
ref: W "... to stamp (earth) ..."; L 899 "... levelled ground ... mound".

def: "a glove", e.g. for working with cement.
[a] "to squeeze rice into a ball in the palm of the hand while eating". [b] "to make madlūke".
"spiced, kneaded dates", with the stones removed.
= I. tindell mete? 3 "do you know when?"
"a coffee-pot". In the old days, when of earthenware, they were made made by men, cf. [347].
* "to show". andellīk iyyēh 29 "we'll show you it".
IV act.pt. f. (no pf. or imp.) midni 1,24 (§ 4.6 example 45),27 ... of a she-camel, "heavily-pregnant".
ref: [908]; Ḥarsūsi medenéy, verb denōt; W IV "to be near ... to lower ..."; L 922.

def: n.; adv. "speed; immediately". sraʕ! bidihdayh! 17 "run! quickly!"

ref: L 839 daʔdaʔa "... [the] hasty replying of a stupid person ..."

def: =+ pronominal suffixes, "take!" dok! (§ 6.26) m.; doš! 18* "help yourself!" f.; dokha! 30 "take it (food)!"
ref: R 31 suggests it is a demonstrative from ḏe + the suffix of the addressed person "there it is ..."; Jb 872 suggests it is contracted from dūnak etc., "near you".
R 125 dīdīh "nipple" in children's talk; EADS 113 Qatari deed.

def: of a feleg, "underground". ... dāwūdiyǣt, yaʕni killha ʕāmlinha Slaymǣn bin Dāwūd 17 "[the conduits] are underground, Solomon son of David made them all".

[a] v.t. 7,17,23 "to look/search for". [b] v.i. "to pass", of time. fil-ʕām id-dāyir 1 "during the last year that has passed". [c] auxiliary verb 17,29 "to begin". dār yinʕaš yinʕāš 7 "he began speaking in tongues".
ref: [a] W "... to go round/... about". [b] W "... to revolve ..."

def: [a] 17,26,30 = I [a]. [b] v.i. "to plough round" palm-trees with a bull. itduwwar biṯor 15 "you plough round with a bull"; it-tedwīr/it-dawār ʕale n-naḫle 8 "ploughing round the palm". [c] v.t. 7 [533c] "to do" the next of a series.
ref: [a] W + ʕale. [b] W "... to rotate something ..."

def: * = I [a]. unsīr undēwir 30 "we'll go and search".
= I [a]. mā yiddawwar šayy 6 "he's not looking for anything".

"the next" of a series, e.g. lucerne-growth between cuts, § 4.6 example 1. Three meanings in particular have become fixed: [a] id-dor 7,122*,17 "next year", in contrast to is-sene "this year" [434], and il-ʕām "last year" [1141]. [b] "a crop-watering" 3,9,21 [24] ... [c] "a course of bricks" 1,20. = [1193]. ddawwir dor ṯēni 7 "you lay another course". [d] dor is also used in variants of the adverbial expression "round about, all (a)round", e.g. ʕalayha ṭaffǣla dor mā dār 20 "[the young lime-tree] must have tilled earth all round [its base]"; dor dāyir 12,29 / dor mā dāyr 17 / dayyār mā dor 30.
ref: [a] L 931 dār "... a year". [d] R 109 dāir mmā dār bi; Ja 685 dāyir madār; H dāyir min dār (Syrian).

def: "[the revolving] heavens". sāfir ʕale d-dīr 27 "he travelled by the night-sky".

ref: Nautical Kuwaiti dēra "compass"; W dawra; L 932 dāʔira "the circuit of something".

def: = [533d]. ʕale l-waʕb dāriyye 3 "all around the brim [of the irrigation-plot]".

ref: [1316]; [1513]; Nautical Kuwaiti dawwār "capstan"; L 932 "a thing that goes round".

def: "the thresher", not necessarily also the local grave-digger (Wilkinson 119) --- anyone digs them.

ref: EADS 103 Baḥrayni H 206 dawšak Turkish; S dūshak "carpet ... bedding ... quilt".
Jb 856 "oyster"; Donaldson "cockles for bait"; L 933 "a species of mother-of-pearl-shell or oyster-shell".

def: "liability, surety". šǣll dokam ʕale hēḏe l-insēn mā ... 1 "he undertook to be a surety that this man wouldn't ..."

[a] "to work one's shift". bydēwim bǣkir 17* "he'll be back at work tomorrow". [b] "to use regularly". bu ydēwim ṣaʕtar mē yeḥtēg daḫtar 29 "whoever takes wild thyme regularly doesn't need a doctor".
ref: [a] W waqt ud-dawām "working hours". [b] W v.i.

def: "always". It often takes verbal pronominal suffixes, domni ana mištugi, mā ʕindi rāḥa 1 "I'm always too busy, I have no rest"; domuk la-mnǣḥiṣ 1 "you're always the uncooperative one". With negative, "never". dom mā šayy fīhin ʕasal 29 "there's never any honey in [these hives]".
[a] 30* "nearer", e.g. of a mountain. [b] "smaller". il-misḥ šwayy adwan ʕan zoliyya 19* "the rug called misḥ is a little smaller than a zoliyya".
of lucerne, "[the] first true leaf" after the dicotyledon-pair. men ykemmel usbūʕ yṭalliʕ dīnār 2 "once [the lucerne] is a week old a dīnār appears".

The difference between demonstratives is not as sharp as in English "this, these" and "that, those", but for convenience they may be classified as follows, [a] to [e] being too common to require authorities. Often also a demonstrative means no more than the def. art. [a] ḏē/hēḏe "this" m., sometimes f. [b] hēḏi "this" f., "these". Like [a] it can be shortened to h before the def. art. e.g. [1591]. [c] ḏēk/hēḏēk "that" m. [d] ḏīk/hēḏīk "that" f. Also m., ḏīk il-yom 30 [1300]; ḏīk il-ḥīn [29]. [e] ḏayle/hēḏayle "those" m. and f. It could also be "these", cf. R 31. [f] hēḏaylēk 12,30 "those" m. and f. Less common, and referring to something more distant, than [e]. [g] hēḏola 21 "those"f. An uncommon variant of [e]. [h] kiḏi 2 (§ 4.6 example 1),3,6 [1541b], kiḏa 17,20*,22 "thus". [hǣḏa also occurs in two examples.]

ref: [1576]; R 410; W ḏarra "... to sprinkle ...", raḏāḏ "drizzle"; L 957 ḏarḏara "... to sprinkle ..."
Ja 661 pl. zārīʕ (misprint for ḏrārīʕ?); W pl. aḏruʕ/ḏurʕān.

def: =+ ʕale "to take shelter in". il-hoš byḏara ʕalayhē 17 "the livestock will take shelter in it".
= I. byitḏarra ʕalayhē 7 "[the livestock] will take shelter in it".
"generosity to guests". 26 did not know the meaning "a school of fiqh", his word for that being ṭāyfa.

ref: W ḏihn "mind ..."; L 984 I "to be intelligent ..."

def: "to see" (W). Most commonly in the interjection terah 4,6,21 "you see/know", but also as a proper verb [817]; mā raythum bʕayni 30 "I haven't seen them myself".
"to show". barāwīk iyyēh 3,20 "I'll show you it".
"leave it!"; brāyak! sīr! 11 "forget it! off you go!"
"an Omani sponsor" of a foreign labourer. 12 said it was a Hindi word not known before this decade.
"to be soft, flabby", e.g. of a drum-skin. tirbaḫ ul-arḍ hēḏi mā fī-hē ʕaṣaṣ 1 "this soil is soft, it has no compaction".
ref: H "trudge in (the sand, of a camel)".

def: "to overwhelm". marbūš pass.pt. [a] 7,11,17 "very busy", e.g. with visitors. [b] 11 "worked-up; mad".
ref: [a] [1428a]; H "to become bushy (tree)". [b] EADS 139 Buraymi marbūṭ "crazy".

def: * "to go together". mā yitrābaʕa rbāʕa 30 "[sugared tea and dates] don't mix".
"the season between high-summer and winter", between the rising of Canopus and the setting of the Pleiades.
ref: [971b]; W "... fourth part ...", rabīʕ "spring ..."; L 1018 "... spring ... autumn ..."

def: [a] "a piece, portion". rubʕat arḍ 11,17 "a piece of land"; rubʕat il-bayt 1,11 "a portion/side of the house". [b] a unit of dry measure. rubʕat Mesqaṭ 11,29 "a Muscat quarter". In Khābūra the rubʕa is a quarter of a suds, which is a quarter of a mikyāl, and weighs a little less then a kyǣs [1399].
ref: [a] [622]; [1287]; L 1017 arbāʕ ur-raʔs "the [four] regions of the head". [b] [150]; W (Egypt).

def: "a companion", human, 1 [1516a], 12*; animal, fī makēn mā fīh rabīʕ 23 "[we have put the poxed goat] where it's on its own".
"Wednesday". A variant of yom il-arbaʕa, W.
"pertaining to ir-rubuʕ". il-ḫarīf rabbāʕi 1 "the season called ḫarīf is like ir-rubuʕ".
"a length of timber" for building, 2 in. x 2 in. or 2 in. x 3 in. etc. Originally, according to 10, one of the four quartered beams of a twelve-foot-long palm-trunk-section.
"a deep irrigation-pit" for a palm cutting (ṣarma). An inland word for [478].
"to return to a former state". ... kull šayy yitrāgiʕ 1 [once high summer is over] everything begins to recover".
ref: W "... to deteriorate ..."; L 1039 "... to revert to a former condition, good or bad ..."

def: "to return". min tinzil il-brūde irtigiʕu humma 1 "once the cold comes [the pearl-divers] return [to Oman]".
"to expect". argīkum 17*,30* "I'll be expecting you"; nargīk 30* 1st pl.

ref: [230]; ruḫāʔ "gentle breeze", IV "... to drop something ..."; H VI "to sprinkle a fine rain (of the sky) ..."

def: "a wooden board" fitting across an irrigation-channel or a side outlet ([1748]), for checking or diverting the flow of water. The inland synonyms [273], [780] are understood but seldom used in Khābūra.
"a bedu boy's circumcision-party", formerly including camel-racing.
ref: [594]; [704]; [1564b]; L 1075 I "(of a camel) to fall down from fatigue".

def: "more stable". wile kēn ṯaqīl yistwi arzaḥ 12 "and if [the amulet] is heavy it becomes more stable [on the chest]".
[a] 11,17 "a door-frame". [b] 17,24 "a point", as a tribal brand [1695].
ref: R 42 rizz; W "staple ..."; L 1074 "... the iron staple into which a bolt fits".
R 418 "weapon dance, warsong"; H I "to go quickly (she-camel)".

def: "to be passed down/transmitted". baqat titrāsal maʕna min kēbir ila kēbir 29 "[bee-keeping-lore] has kept on being passed down with us from generation (lit. grown man) to generation".
ref: [1347]; W "to keep up a correspondence ..."; L 1082 "... to do something alternately with someone".

def: "to throw at". A Šināṣ word. 7,11,17 said that at Šināṣ, "I threw the stone at you" is aršaḫak mil-ḥaṣa; at Sohar it is arūšak mil-ḥaṣa; and at Khābūra armīk mil-ḥaṣa.
"a gāzra-rope" from the ground over the duwwēre, joined to the kurr by the yēmiʕ [256], according to 12.

ref: [a] P rasīd from Persian; HJ 757 raseed from English, shaped, probably by Persian rasīda "arrived". [b] W taqrīr ul-arṣād.

def: "compressed". tṣīr el-arḍ rāsse [sic: rāṣṣe?] šwayy 12 "the earth gets a bit compressed".
"a piece of split wood/zora" bound back together around an animal's scrotum to castrate by compression alone. It takes longer and is more awkward than [334], but is safer.
[a] 17,20 "to clean ground of large roots". [b] 17 "to thresh".
ref: [a] [342]; [1578]; H "... to till (the earth)". [b] [538]; R 48 roḍḍāme "pulp"; W raḍḍa "to crush ..."; H "to walk heavily (beast ...)"

def: "a sum paid by the husband to his first wife on taking a second".
of a palm, "to produce ripe dates". yerṭab iṣ-Ṣallāni 1 "the Ṣallāni-palm's dates are ripe". = [1338].
ref: W ruṭab "... ripe dates"; L 1101 IV.

def: obs. "to speak in a foreign language", usually Balūši. trāṭinu 7,11 3rd pl. pf.
ref: W I "... to talk gibberish"; L 1103.

def: "midwinter". is-sine btinzil il-imrīʕi fī Ṣufar 1 "this year midwinter will fall in Ṣafar". According to 17 mrīʕi was a man in the olden days who hibernated in a cave for the forty coldest days of winter.
ref: arbʕīn il-ʕaǧūz in Iraq; Swahili mrao "... the cool season".

def: [a] 7 "thick", opposite of waṣam. [b] 11 of soil, "heavy", opposite of rahīf.
"to let [a camel] go off and graze untended". wayn bʕīr mālek? raġadteh 11 "where's your camel?" "I let him loose".
ref: [735]; W "... to be carefree"; L 1112 IV (of cattle).

def: "to be let loose". ragil mitraġġad 11 "a man away from home, living a fast life".
"communally-owned camels". ir-raġāyid mǣl il-gimǣʕa 11 "the clan's grazing her". raġīde one.
"to give [a newly-sown crop] its first watering". From the second onwards saqa is used.

ref: R 7; L 1125 I "... to bind a camel's arm to its shank ..."
L 1117 rafaʔa "... to calm someone ...", VI "to agree together ..."

def: "[the edible] last stage of creamed milk". When you take the cream (zibda) off milk (ḥalib), you have leben, which, when left, turns into raqīq. ḥalib when left turns into rob.
"to seal, stop up" a gap. in-naḥal yraqqum boh il-bayt 29 "the bee caps the cell with [mqill-resin]".
ref: L 1138 I "... to seal, stamp, imprint ..."

def: "a fireplace of stones" for cooking. Also called mwaqqad iṭ-ṭahi [1715].
ref: [170]; R 158 trukbe "stone kettle-stove"; Ḥarsūsi arēkeb "to put food in a pot to cook over the fire"; W "... structure ..."; L 1145 ar-rawākid.

def: "the 10-20 foot-long gāzra-derrick cross-piece"on which the mangūr sits. It is supported by rawēgil [584].
"an interior portion" of a courtyard 1; "a corner" of a gelba 17.
"to sink". tirkis dāḫl raml 17 "[a car] sinks into sand".
ref: [477]; [1166]; W VIII "... to be thrown back ..."; L 1146 v.t. "to turn something over ..."; H rakāsa "pole stuck into the earth".

def: "the men in charge of an exorcism, the interpreters of tongues".
"to spend the evening chatting". webaʕd it-trāwīḥ riǧʕu ile l-bayt ʕād yramsu weyitḫarrafu 26 "and after the evening prayers in Ramadan they return home and spend the evening chatting and talking".
ref: [413]; [947]; § 4.6 1.1.1; Ḥarsūsi remōs "to talk, chat"; W samura.

def: "a crown", most usually of a lucerne-plant; rummānt el-ʕuḏq 25 "the head of the date-raceme", where the tie is attached at ḥidār 296.
"to sow". min yiẓhar Shayl tirmāh daḫl l-arḍ 17 "once Canopus has risen you sow [ṣayf] in the ground". yirmi (W) is also used, [597].

ref: Jb 828 Hindi or Persian; S; P.
R 258 mrungāḥa; Jb 871 marangūḥa; W inraǧaḥa/tamarǧaḥa "to swing back and forth ..."

def: "rice". Uncommon in Khābūra where ʕayš [1147] is the usual word.
"scrawny", of a plant 2; "soft", of fruit 6; "light", of soil 11.
"to rest". yrāwiḥ aẓ-ẓuhr 12 "[the gāzra-worker] rests at noon".
"self", + pronominal suffixes, e.g. brūḥha 6,17 ... "by itself"; bruwāḥna 13* "by ourselves".
"ease of life". farqiyya kabīra mā bayn mrāḥena ilʔēn wemrāḥetna l-awwal 16 "there's a big difference between our ease of life now and before". For marāḥ see [1460].
"to fall", of price. rāḫ is-siʕr 1 "the price came down.
"a parsnip-sized radish", with edible leaves. = fīl/figil.
"a small recessed alcove", in a well-housing for tools 12, in a wall for Apis florea 30.

[a] "to pursue" freely-grazing animals. yrūġhin yrawwuġhin 23 "he goes after them, he pursues them". [b] 7,11 "to drive [an animal] along". = [369]. [c] "to chase someone away". rūġah! kuššeh! 11 "get rid of him! see him off!"
[a] 7 "a small silver horn", worn in the belt, for holding a kohl-bodkin; "a large engraved horn", used in the mountains for calling livestock. [b] 20 [1326] "an onion-bulb".

mā rām, mā yrūm [a] auxiliary verb 10,12,23 [206a] ... "to be unable to". = [1051a]. [b] v.i. + l- "to be unable to do something". mā rām loh 17 "he couldn't do it". [c] v.i. "to be unwell". Only in the act.pt. (?) mā rāym 7 "unwell".
ref: [b] W rāma v.t. to desire ..." [c] Jb 875.

def: "to finish". rawwanteh 11* "I've completed it"; mruwwuneh? 11*,19* "have you finished it?"
obs. "bit by bit". = marra marra 7; ʕidd rayze rayze 11 "tot [it] up item by item".
ref: Jb 862 from Persian "in bits, in pieces"; W rāzu u "to weigh, examine ..."; S rez-rez.

def: "to wait for". arīḍak 7* "I'll wait for you". = [306].
ref: R 203; L 1186 rāḍa (yarūḍu) nafsahu "... he subdued himself ... became forbearing ..."
W ʕala r-rīq "before breakfast ..."; L 1203 rayyūq "the first part of anything"; H rāʔiq.

def: "a basket", about two and a half foot across, woven from palm-leaves and used for ḫarāf [411].

ref: [235]; W "to drive back ..."; L 1216 "... to urge animals on ..."

def: "the ox-walk well". A less common pronunciation of [236].
[a] 17,19 "a small noose on the gāzra kurr-rope", through which passes the bucket-handle. [b] 17 [814],19 "a noose-shaped brand".
ref: [a] R 44 "a leg tie"; H "peg of a water-skin, ring on the butt of a spear ..." [b] [1695].

def: of a child/kid etc., "to take to solid food". yizgi ʕan ummuh 17 "it no longer wants its mother's milk".
=+ ʕale "to deceive someone", e.g. of a mirage.
"to move aside from". izḥaf ʕanneh! 11 "get out of the way [of the snake]!"
"difficulty", e.g. of well-digging in the mountains.
"dust" in the air, "dirt" in the house.

ref: R 76 "stocking"; W "a kind of shoe"; H "high-heeled leathern boots (Greek)".

def: [a] v.i. 17,23 (§ 4.6 example 46) of animals, "to crowd/stick together". [b] v.t. 7,11 "to bind something". bitzurr iṣ-ṣarma 25 "[then] you bind up the palm-cutting".
ref: [b] [699]; W "to button (up) ..."; L 1223 "... to draw together ..."

def: ... "a poor, gypsy-type", with his own language.
"to draw water". tizʕab ʕale ṯ-ṯor 8 "you draw water by the ox".
ref: L 1230 "... to fill (a vessel) with liquid ..."

def: "a dhow", smaller than a lanš, W "launch ..."

[a] v.t. 17* "to suck up, drink". makīna tizġaṭ il-māy 1 "a well-pump sucks the water up"; tizġuṭ il-māy inte wāyid 1 "you drink a lot of water". [b] v.i. + ʕale 17* "to importune, exert pressure on". il-wāli zaġaṭ ʕalayh 1 "the mayor forced him [to pay the fine immediately]".
"a rush; pressure". zaġṭ māy 17 "a rush of water"; zuġṭ il-māy 7,17 "water-pressure"; zaġṭ id-dem 1 "blood-pressure".
[a] v.t. zefen yizfin, iz-zufūn 10,26 "to tie clipped palm-fronds" into sheets [506]. yzifnu dʕūn 9 "they're making palm-frond-sheeting". [b] v.i. * "to dance" (W). iz-zifēne 26 "ʕīd-dancing".
"to give alms". el-ḥīne ma ḥad yzekki, mā yzekkūn 6 "nowadays, no one gives alms, they don't give alms".
* = II. fī kull sene marra yitzekki 26 "once every year he gives alms".
"to remove". hēḏēk zelleh! 30 "take that one out!"

ref: [402b]; W zunbūr, pl. zanābīr "hornet"; for m/n cf. [1383].
R 137 "cheerful"; W I "to escape ..."; H I "to scamper off (Syrian)".
W zumla "... company (of people)"; L 1253 zawmala.

def: "[the whole] arm". zendeh dʕīf [sic] 17 "he (lit. his arm) is weak".
ref: [1749]; R 56; Nautical Kuwaiti zand "one of the stout iron rails on either side of the foredeck to which the anchor cable is made fast ..." or perhaps, "any long object that is found aboard in pairs"; Ḥarsūsi "forearm"; L 1257 "forearm".

def: "to abuse, slander". wāḥad yzannīk ... 11 "[if] someone slanders you ..."
ref: W zināʔ "adultery ..."; L 1260 "to impute to someone fornication ..."

def: "to flower". il-ʕalʕalēn mā ysawwi ferrāḫ, mā yizhi 29 "the juniper doesn't produce blossom, it doesn't flower".

ref: [544a]; Nautical Kuwaiti zām "a watch or stint"; Swahili zamu.

def: [a] 17 "a bullet". [b] 17 "tools, equipment". ḥaddēd ygūl gīb zēnti 11 "a blacksmith says, bring my tools". [c] 17 "a coffee-pot". A bedu word for midlé [518].

ref: EADS 125 Dubai "excess"; W ziyāda, mazīd; H "... excess (Syrian)".

def: "to bind up" the leaves of a palm-cutting until it has struck root, e.g. with palm-fibre, sacking or a zora, to stop the sun hitting the centre of the young plant. tzayyir iṣ-ṣarma biz-zora 25 "you bind up the cutting with the mid-rib". A variant of [671b]; [791].
"a large exorcism", often in a distant or secret place, with drums, poetry etc.

ref: [133]; [254]; Swahili sila; S sulla "tub" from Arabic; W salla "basket".

def: "to wash oneself in". wel-feleg ysibḥūh 30 "and [the bedu] wash in [our] conduit".
"soft, dry, white earth", encrusted with salts.
"a week". taqrīb muddat sbūʕ 9 "for about a week".
"a monkey". is-sibēl ǣdmi baʕd 13 "monkeys are human too". sabbēle 26 "a she-monkey".
"a row of gillēb" ([252]), irrigated from one channel.
"to chew the cud". il-ḥimār ma tsgar, ḥarām 13 "donkeys aren't ruminants, [so] they're forbidden as food".

= I. il-ḥimār mā yistigur 11 "the donkey doesn't ruminate". This word is probably a corruption of root g-r-r stem X, cf. R 187 and W iǧtarra. In which case stem I above might be a back-formation from VIII.
"a short rope", made from palm-fibre, used for ḥidar [296].
ref: L 1308 I "... to make something hang down ..."

def: "a raised sitting/sleeping platform" of dʕūn [506]. According to 1, this is a Swayq word for what is called in Khābūra mnēme [1598].
* "to have the saḥūr-meal", before dawn in Ramadan. sāʕa arbaʕ saḥḥaru 26 "at 4 a.m. they ate saḥūr".
ref: R 160 "to call out the time for the last meal before day from the mosque"; W V; L 1316 "... to give someone saḥūr".

def: [a] 1,17 "a round, metal vessel", used by the bedu to keep coffee-cups in water, smaller than a ṭāsa (W). [b] saḥlit ir-rās 17 "the skull".
"a hand-spade" with a three-inch-wide blade, used for digging wells etc. A little smaller than a hibbiyya [1601].

lex: saḫal m. 23, saḫle f. 1 [1248], 11*,13* ... / sḫala 19*, pl. sḫal 11*, sḫāl 23
lex_arb: سخل (ذكر)، سخلة (أنثى)/ سخلة، الجمع سخل، سخال

def: [a] 2,6 [203],23 ... "to be enough for". [b] is-sidǣd "to reconcile". seddayt mā baynhum, wal-lefthum 11 "I reconciled their differences, I made peace between them". sidǣd ʕaqs šiqāq 17* "reconciliation is the opposite of disunity".
ref: [a] W sadda I "... to be apposite ..." [b] W sadda u "to plug up ..."

def: =+ ʕale "to put pressure on". ḫarāb lemme tseddik ʕalayh 7* "[the shovel-handle shows itself] broken when you press down on it".
"moist". arḍ sidiyye 12 (§ 4.2 example 7) "moist earth", not too sandy, therefore not too thirsty.
"colostrum", of a goat. Also called ʕaqīd [1111].

[a] v.i. 6 of sheep and goats, "to graze freely", but with someone with them. il-hoš māl il-mazraʕa mā ysarḥin 16 "the project-farm's livestock don't go out to graze [with any of you]". [b] v.t. of a human, to take hoš out to graze" and stay with them. yisraḥhin 23 "he takes them grazing"; surḥha etʕab 23 "grazing them is tiring".
= I [b]. tsarraḥhin ṣob il-māy 24 "you take them grazing towards water".
"a flattened area", for drying limes 11,13*,25* / dates 26.
"a skin", for water or churning milk. suʕun māy 30 "a skinful of water".
"to trade, do business". it-tēgir ysēʕi 12 "merchants buy something here and sell it there".
ref: R 132 musāʕira "commerce"; L 1366 "to try to outpace someone ..."

def: "employment". mā fīhe awwal mesʕa keme taww 12 "[Oman] didn't used to have jobs like nowadays".

ref: [1514]; Jb 857; W isfīn "wedge"; L 1375 "... a hewing or shaping tool ..."; H "... wedge ..."

def: of women, "to churn" milk in a skin. To do so in a pot is maḫaḍ (W).
ref: W "to slap, clap"; L 1706 ṣaqaʕa "to strike, slap ..."

def: "to irrigate". sqāh! 21 "water it!" Coastal Khābūrans say yisgi, as W.
* "to drink". z-zambor mā ysaqqi min zahor 30 "drones don't drink from flowers".
= I. tistiqa minhe l-arḍ 17 "you irrigate the land with it".
* "to shoot" a rifle. bysektu 30 3rd m. pl. imp. Denominative from [750b].
"to be irregular, chaotic". lā ṣār mā inṭafal el-arḍ yṣīr yistikir il-beḏer 17 "if the earth isn't made into a tilth, the seeds will come up irregularly".

ref: [477]; W V "to grope about ..."; H "... to slumber".

def: "a jinni", that comes down at a naʕš and speaks through the medium. = [904b].
ref: EADS 135 Abu Ẓabi sikni, pl. sukūn "a kind of jinni"; W I "... to inhabit".
W I "... to strip something off ..."

def: "to trickle". ysalsal taḥt il-miradd 17 "[the water] trickles under the check".
"to fly up". sillig fog 13* "[the bee-swarm] flew up".
"to pour with force". sell il-wǣdi 17 "the wadi was in spate".

ref: L 1396 salla "... the rush of a horse in racing ..."
[a] R 118 "sting (of a scorpion)". [b] Jb 873 sillā, pl. silā; L 1398 sullāʔ coll., sullāʔa one.

def: "to dung" the soil. tismidhe 20 "you dung it"; arḍ masmūda 20 "fertilised soil".
[a] 2 (§ 4.6 example 1),9*,11 ... "[the] leaf-bud in a lucerne-crown". [b] 12 "a cold chisel".
of a samsūm-bite, "to swell up and itch".
... "a small, black [biting] ant". Also called sqāt [744]. It smells unpleasant when crushed.
ref: L 1418 sumsum "... red ants ... that bite painfully ..."; according to Nöldeke (Beiträge, p. 118), this word was originally Aramaic.

def: [a] "to go inland". Opposite of [1587]. tisnid ʕalwe 1 "you go towards the sayḥ". [b] "to mount" a camel, a wall 17; "climb" a palm 11, more usually rakab. [c] "to place". tisnid il-mayyit foq muġsil min simme 17 "you lay the corpse on a palm-mat washing-place".
"a fierce (fabulous?) wild animal" of the past, the size of a horse and dappled ([635]).
"ease". guwwid la-ḫṣiyya mēluh, yṣīr fi shāla 24 "grasp [the animal's] scrotum tightly and [castration] will happen easily".
"pertaining to Canopus"; of earth, "loamy". arḍ shayliyya, mištirka maʕha r-raml uṭ-ṭīn 17 "it's Canopus-earth, it's got sand and clay intermixed".

ref: R 401; W "... absent-minded ..."; L 1456 I "... to be still, quiet, gentle ..."

def: "a check, water-diverter". A mountain word for miradd [588].
ref: [273]; Nautical Kuwaiti swāra, coll. suwār "beam, deck-beam"; W sūr "... enclosure ..."

def: "to do, make". ane waḥdi msawwinhe 30 "I made it myself" act.pt.; msawwāy leh ṣadr 6 "a basin was made for [the gāzra]" pass.pt. It can stand for almost any action, depending on the context of the conversation, e.g. eating suwwi! 18* "eat!" imv. f. s.; putting 15 [276] imv. m. s.

[a] 15 (§ 4.4 example 9),23 (§ 4.4 example 4) "to happen". [b] 12 [592],15 [276] "to become". [c] "to be born". ams imsitwi 15* "[the kid] was born yesterday". [d] 7*,11* (§ 6.14) "to grow". [e] "to be suitable". ... yistuwi 19 "[if you do such and such] it'll do".
"a desert-plain", in Khābūra, between the coastal palm-belt and the mountain-foothills.
"a woven camel-rug", usually striped red and black.
"to fix something firmly", e.g. a well-pump on its seat.
ref: W I "to sink into the ground ..."

def: "a long steel rod", used for reinforcing courses of cement blocks ([395]).
ref: Nautical Kuwaiti "upright iron rod in quarter-deck rails"; W "... skewer ..."

def: indeclinable adj./adv. [a] "straight ahead", of a road 2*,7*, cf. [790]; "straight down", of arms 26 [1375]; "smooth", of timber 1; "level", of ground 13*,17 [1018],20 [1050]; "plain", of colour 12. [b] Often coupled with marra [1461d] for emphasis, sīr sīda marra! 19*,26* "go straight ahead [of you], all the way!"; ḫaṭaf marra sīda 17 "[the bird] flew off straight away".
ref: [a] W sāda "... unicoloured, uniform (fabric)". [b] P sīdā dialectical and colloquial for sīdhā adj. and adv. "... directly ..."

def: "to go to" (W), is steadily losing ground to the pan-Arabic rāḥ, yrūḥ but not in the common expression at the end of directions, winte sāyir 3,6,12 ... "straight all the way", lit. "and you going"; or at the end of a list, "and so on", "etc."
ysayyirah bil ḥibēl 2 "he ties down [the date-raceme] with the strings". msayyar 12,29* [of a goat-kid's stomach] "knotted up", allegedly with indigestion from colostrum, cf. [1405].
"to be alongside something". ana msāyrinnek 17 act.pt. "I'm [sitting] next to you."
= [792]. [This does not correspond to a verb form in any obvious way, so I can only conclude that it must be a verbal noun of the preceding entry.—M.D.S.]

ref: [729]; W "... ewe" ("a ewe" in Khābūra is gaʕde [247]); L 1623 "sheep or goat, m. or f."

def: The pan-Arabic colloquial meanings of intention "in order to", and of possession "belonging to, for", are still rare in Khābūra, the word having a more literal meaning "from the affair of", either [a] "as a result of, because of". in-nēs tḥibb zirāʕat hēḏi taww minšēn yimši bisirʕa 9 "people like growing [vegetables rather than dates] now because they're quick"; rāʕi l-ḥaywēn taʕbēn minšēnhin, taʕbēn min taʕbhin 24 "the owner of the beasts is in a poor state because of them. Tired as a result of their tiredness". cf. also ʕale š-šēn inne 104b "on account of the matter that", "because of". Or [b] less figuratively, "from". mā arīd šayy ġayr minšēn ʕAli 11 "I don't want anything else from ʕAli"; mā fīh minšēn naḫīl mawḍūʕ 15 "there's no money (lit. subject) to be had from palms".

ref: R 158; W "blurred shape ..."; L 1495 "... form seen from a distance ..."

def: "trouble". dāymen ysawwi mišbára, dāymen ysawwi mḥakke, dāymen ysawwi ḥawēša 17 "he's always making trouble, slander and ferment".
ref: W mušāǧara; L 1495 I "... to behave insolently ..."
[1354]; [1363]; Jb 819; H šabriyya "travelling-basket on a camel (Egyptian)".
Jb 853 šabah "water moss"; W šabah "... brass"; L 1501 šaban "green substance that overspreads stagnant water".

def: "to beg". iz-zuṭṭi yišḥaṯ minnuk 17 "the gipsy begs from you".
"to strike something". bayšuḫṭuh bikibrīt ubayilbag 1 "he would strike matches to it and it would light".
ref: [424]; R 129 "to rule (a line)"; Ḥarsūsi śeḫāṭ "to strike a light"; W šaḥaṭa "... to strike (a match)".

def: "a stroke", e.g. of a brand-marking. šuḫṭ keme zēgil 17 "a stroke similar to a noose-shaped brand".
"to sieve". yšaḫlu r-ramlu 25 "they sieve the sand".
"a sieve" 12*,25; "a well-pipe foot-valve" 1,12*,13* ... gīb leh guṭʕa mišḫal! 9 "bring him a piece of wire-mesh!"
=+ fī "to water". hēḏi yelbe terāha, ridd ʕanhe, batišrab fī hēḏi 6 "you see this plot here, [if you] stop the flow to it you'll water this one".
"squash", e.g. lime. Not in construct. ġarša mēl šerbet ʕoda 30 "a large bottle of squash".
ref: R 99 "a drink of lemonade"; S "... sherbet, a medicinal draught".
R 145; W šaraḥa (šaraḫa "to crack ... (Egyptian)"); L 1531 "to cleave (flesh) ..."
[b] P ćaras "... the exhudation of the flowers of hemp ..."
[45]; [1069]. Probably a secondary formation from the verb of 823.
Jc 497 "removing palm-branch-bases from the trunk with a maḫlab and tearing off the fibre and throwing it down"; W šaraṭa "... to rip open".

def: "to pour, flow". il-māy bīšarraʕ fil-yelbe 1 "the water will flow into the plot".

ref: W šarīʕa "... (approach to) a water hole ...", šāriʕ "... street"; L 1534 I "to enter (water) ..."

def: "outside". tʕāl šerwa l-bilēd! 6 "come outside the settlements!"; awwal min sarwa taww 5 "formerly, as opposed to nowadays", lit. "from outside of". A variant of šāwur [882].
"to be in a hurry". mištaṭṭ 17,19* act.pt.
ref: Ḥarsūsi meśtét "busy, packing for a journey"; W "to go to extremes ..."

def: "to break into pieces". titšaṭṭaf il-qwǣlib 17*, "the moulds are smashed".

ref: W šaẓiya; L 1552 šaẓīẓ "... a stick split in several places".

def: "a wide irrigation-channel" in which plants are grown. The Emirate synonym of ḫabīl [397].
ref: L 1558 mašʕab "... a path ..."; H šiʕb "... underground watercourse".

def: "to feel emotion for", e.g. a woman.
ref: EADS 94 Baḥrayni; W "... to feel something ..."

def: "dried-up palm-flower-spathes". awwal ṣāret kīfe baʕdayn ybiset ṣāret šaġrāfe 1 "at first it was a spathe, then when it dried it was an old pod".

"work, a job". hēḏe šuġlitna 12 "this is our work"; 
šuġle ʕode 12 "a big job".

[a] v.i. 26 "to side". Ġāfri yšeff byē Ġāfri. kull fḫāyiḏ fī kīs wāḥid, šeff aw ṣuff wāhid 12 "a Ġāfri sides with a Ġāfri, each clan [of theirs] is in one bag, one federation or alliance". [b] v.t. "to give someone preference". šeffaytak 17 "I gave you preference".
= I [b]. ešteff aḫūy ʕan aḫti 17 "I prefer my brother to my sister".
[a] 12 [842],17 "a tribal federation". = ṣuff [936]. [b] min šeff 17 prep. "for the sake of".
[a] "to push someone over". tišgaʕah min wara uyrūḥ kebeb 1 "you push him over from behind and he falls flat". [b] 11 "to seize someone's neck from behind" in jest.

ref: S šagāl. See also root mškl.
L 1590 šakw "... small lamb/camel"; Spanish chico, adj. "small, tiny", n. "child".

def: =+ bi 2 "to tuck up" clothes, e.g. for work. itšellaḥ biṯyābuk! 1 "tuck up your clothes!"
= I. baʕdayn tšellaḫ il-arḍ 21 "then [when the sweet-potatoes sprout] the earth cracks".
"an olden-day dagger", smaller than a ḫangar.
ref: R 199 "lance"; W šilfa "(razor) blade"; H šilf "iron rod (Syrian)"; R. Burton's "Pilgrimage ..." 1855, vol. 3, p. 74 "The Beduin have a spear called shalfah, a bamboo or palm stick garnished with a head about the breadth of a man's hand".

def: "to be skew". minšilqa ʕale gēnib 17 "twisted to one side", of a length of cement channelling.
"wobbly", of a chair one leg a little short; "deformed on one side", of a human.
[a] v.t. 1 "to push someone over". = [845a]. [b] v.t. 11 "to seize someone's neck from behind" in jest. [c] v.i. 11 "to snap".
ref: [a] R 253 tšanqoʕ "to lie supine"; H šalqā "to prostrate so. on the back". [b] = [845b]; [1236b]. [c] = [1236a].

def: "to take, lift". It can be doubly transitive, šellitna r-rukǣb ʕUmān 21 "the riding-camels took us up to Oman".
ref: [1682]; W šāla I, which is now as commonly heard in Khabura.

def: [a] "to set out", of a human 4*; "to get out" from mud, of a car 7. [b] ištell ṭāliʕ 1,6,17 "to start coming up", e.g. of a plant.
ref: [a] R 124 "to start (on a journey)"; L 1591 VII "to be driven (away) ..."

def:
[a] 1 "a star" that sets over the sea around March.
[b] 1,12 "the cold March-wind", coming from the direction of the star's setting, lasting up to four hours, and making the palms shake and drop some of their bisr.
ref: [a] not Lambda Scorpii (aš-Šawla) which rises due south in late May. For it, see R.H.Allen, Star Names, their Lore and Meaning, New York, p.370.

def: "to be an in-law to". iḏa mšēmig ḥad ... 12 "if he's someone's brother-in-law ..."

ref: [a] [109]. [b] R 91; Swahili shemeji "a relation by marriage, usually of the first degree".

def: "a peak". šemḫ il-gebel 17 "the top of the mountain".
"to work" leather. šemmār yišmur il-gihēb māl il-ġanam waysawwi delu 11 "a leather-worker works the skin of sheep or goats and makes a bucket".
ref:
[39]; W II "... to roll/turn up (a garment) ..."; H šamraǧa "to 
stitch (clothes)". But it is probably a secondary formation from [871].

def: [a] 9,11,2.5 ... "a spike" of the female palm-raceme (ʕiḏq). If strong enough it is often used to tie the ʕiḏq down at ḥidār. The word can be used loosely to mean the spike of the male flower, more precisely ʕaṭīl. [b] 1 "a spike" of an item of women's silver head-jewelry.
ref: [a] W "... stalk with date cluster ..."; L 1596.
