R 279. The more common meaning in Khābūra is "to smell something". (W) [229].

def: "a kiss", given as a synonym of bosa W.

ref:
L 1606 + ilā "to look at something antagonistically ...", šānif ʕan 
"turning away ..."

def: "one of", e.g. fruit, small plants. - [277]; [1332]; R 85.
"a pancake", about one inch across. - 891; Ḥarsūsi šōb "round of bread".
=+ ʕale "to scheme with". šurt ʕale Ḫamīs 17 "I schemed with Ḫamīs".
ref: W ašāra ʕalā bi "to suggest to someone something ..."; H "to advise someone" (Syrian).

def: "outside". sīr šāwur! 17 "go outside!" Given as a Šarqiyya misnomer for sīr ḫārig!

ref: Jb 854 "nitre", from Hindi and Persian; Wilkinson 213; S "... nitre, saltpetre ..."
[1710c]; W as-Šīʕa. In Khābūra they are more usually called il-ʕAgam 7,17 ... (W "... Persians").

def: [a] 7,17 "to show". [b] * "to have a good look". watšuwwaf inta wutnaẓaruh 30 "[we will climb the mountain] and you'll have a good look and see it".
"to look closely at". ʕād hēḏēk tšawwaf li-ktēb 12 "that man (il-bāṣir [108]) consulted the book".
"to be visible". tinsǣf hiyya min al-Xābūra 8 "it can be seen from Khābūra".
[a] = VII. yštēf min bʕīd 21 * "it can be seen from far". [b] "to have a look". tba tštūf? 21 "do you want to have a look?"
of a she-camel, "to want the male".
ref: [128]; L 1622 šālat biḏanabihā "the she-camel raised her tail having become pregnant"; see also root šyl.

def:
of a she-camel, [a) 24 (§ 4.2 example 6) "to conceive". 
[b] 7* "to give birth". baʕd min kemmilit šhūrhe bitšawwal "when she has completed her months, she'll give birth".
ref: [a] [1752]. [b] L 1622 "(of a she-camel) to be seven/eight months since giving birth or conceiving ..."
Jb 840; L 1490 šaʔama "to make someone journey to Syria".

def: "to roast". tišwa qiṭʕat lḥam 11 "you roast a piece of meat".
"a semi-nomadic pastoralist", living in the desert-plain and mountain-valleys.
ref: L 1625 "a possessor of šāʔ (sheep and/or goats) ..."

def: "an ʕīd-meal" of cow-, goat- or sheep-meat baked in a wḫīfe [1768].
[a] 25 "an old man" (W). siyyēbna min sābuq 16 "our elders in the past". [b] 24 "an old he-camel".
"an old man". A term of respect. 17 said it was 'one of the seventy names of God'.

[a] šayḫ 17*,29 ... / šēḫ 28, pl. šyūḫ "a queen-bee".
[b] šayḫ/šyūḫ/mšāyiḫ "a jinni" that is contacted at a naʕs [naʕš?—M.D.S.] and speaks through the medium. The plural has a singular meaning, cf. EADS 250.

ref: W "bottle of the narghile ..."; S "... a glass, bottle ..." from Turkish šīš "swelling".

def: of a she-camel, "about two months pregnant".
ref: [522]; W "to carry ..."; L 1623 šāʔila "seven or eight months pregnant"; see also root šwl.

def: "a woman's black over-garment", for wearing outdoors, smaller than an ʕibǣ.
ref: Jb 851 "mantle"; šāl "shawl, mantle ..."; the Persian word is perhaps of Indian origin, from Sanskrit śavala "variegated", HJ 824.

def:
[a] 1,12,23 ... "there is/are". = fīh. [b] + negative mā šayy ... 5 [153a],11,22 [185] ... "there is/are no .../none". cf. also the hendiadys, zahor mā fīh šayy, naḥal mā fīh šayy 30 "when there are no flowers there are no bees". [c] šayy ... šayy ... "some ... others ..." šayy ysammūh il-wayg šayy ysammūh mʕalqa 12 "some call [the gāzra-yoke] 'wayg', others 'mʕalqa'". [d] pl. ešye "kinds". fīh naḫīl yaʕni ešye keṯīra 20 "there are, I mean, many different kinds of date-palms". [e] + kull "everything; the whole of". kull šayy zeraʕ ḍāʕ 6 "the whole of agriculture is ruined"; attenuated to kulliš/killiš 16 "everything, the whole; completely". kulliš il-ʕasq 11 "the whole raceme"; šayḫ iṭ-ṭuyūr kulliš 17 "[the hoopoe] is the chief of the birds, all of them". [f] * šīšī "there is no/none", a bedu expression according to 7. fil-bard mā yuḫrug, šīšī rʕī 29 "in winter [the bees] don't come out, there's no forage". cf. R 112. 
[g] * ši, added to a verb to negate it. This is similar to the Egyptian usage but is not a borrowing. cf. R 282. It is not used in Khābūra. yifraqši 28 "[these bees] don't swarm".
=+ the verbal pronominal suffix of the subject. A bedu feature. ṣāni arūḥ 1 "I'm going"; ṣāne nrūḥ 1,7* "we're going"; ṣāḥ ḥayrūḥ 7* "he'll go"; ṣāḥin yrūḥin 7* "they (f.) are going".
"concrete flooring", e.g. of a shed, cistern or irrigation-channel.

"to become, be". in-nēs ṣubḥet fī makēn wahid, ṣubḥet fī ʕamal 16 "the bedu have become static, they've become employed"; l-awwal ṣbiḥna taʕbǣnīn 16 "we used to be in a bad way"; min yiṣbaḥ iṣ-ṣubḥ ... 23 "once it's morning ..."
"a small, paneless window", e.g. of a mosque.
"a large china bowl", e.g. for rice.
"to recover". tšūf il-embe ṣaḥa 21 "see how the mango-tree has recovered".
ref: W ṣaḥḥa (ṣaḥā u "... to sober up ...")

def: "a shallow basin" at the top of the gāzra-well, on to which the bucket is poured, and from which the water flows into the channel(s). itšarraʕ id-delu foq iṣ-ṣadr 8 "the [water in the] bucket pours on to the basin".
ref: W "chest ..."; L 1661 "the upper front part of anything ..."

def: "the first palms of a settlement" to be reached by the feleg.
ref: L 1661 ṣādira "the upper part (of the valley) ..."

def:
"correctness" (W), as in ṣidquh 12 / ṣidq ur-raggēl 14 
"he/the man is quite right".
"a mosque-forecourt". Not a courtyard of a house, which is hoš, W.
ref: R 136 (incorrectly, cf. [966]) saraḥ; W "... lofty edifice ..."; L 1675 "... lofty building", ṣarḥa "court of a house ..."

Jb 822 "brazier" from Persian; Nautical Kuwaiti sarēdān (ṣurīdān) in the dialect of Aden) "a movable fire-box used for cooking with charcoal"; S dān "an affix denoting what contains anything", cf. degdān 
"fireplace".
Ḥarsūsi meṣár "turban"; W I "... to bind something ..."

def: of a cow, "noisily to want the bull". il-baqar yṣurfin 25* "cows ..."
ref: [128]; W "... to creak ..."; L 1680 (of most female animals).

def: [a] "young palm-cuttings". ṣarme one. [b] 12* "a palm-garden", by synechdoche. [c] other "young trees", e.g. ṣarmet moz 15 "a banana-sucker".
ref: [a] W I "... to cut off ..." [b] [1046b]; [1525]; L 1684 ṣirma/ṣarīma.
R 159 "to mend"; Jb 827; W ṣaffā; L 1696 "to bind ..."

def:
"copper". margal mǣl ṣufr 12 "a copper cooking- 
pot".
"a large cooking-pot", e.g. for rice. Originally of copper.
"to stamp down" newly cropped suḥḥ ([719]) "and/or pack them into bags". itṣuffeh foq baʕḍeh baʕḍ 9 "you stamp down [the suḥḥ] on top of each other".

ref: W "... group"; L 1693 "... a company of men in line ..."
W "to stand with one foot slightly raised ..."

def: "standing to attention", of an army. = ṣafnīn 11 act.pt. pl.
"it's all over". ṣawāfi, bass ṣawāfi, bass ḫalāṣ, mā šayy ʕād, rgaʕ 12 "it's all over, that's it, it's finished, there's nothing more, back you go!"
ref: W ḫalaṣa/ṣafā "... to be pure ...", ḫalaṣa (colloq.) "to be finished ..." The meaning "lands to which the state is entitled", Wilkinson 155 and L 1704, was unknown to 12 and 14.

def: "a blaze or patch" of lighter-coloured hair on an animal's body, head or legs.
ref: L 1707 "a whiteness in the middle of the head of an animal or bird".

def: "to pull something." aṣalbeh 17 "I'm pulling the door to".
of water, "to flow freely". miṣṭulib 17 act.pt.
of water-flow, "speed". il-māy yinzil biṣ-ṣlūb 20 "[now that the channels are plastered] the water flows fast".
ref: L 1712 ṣulb "... strong, robust ...", māʔ ṣalīb "water on which cattle grow fat, strong and hard".

def: "to make something" for the first time (as well as W "... to repair"). miṯil mṣallaḥinneh inte 17 "a mosque like the one you built" .
=+ ʕale 17 "to stumble across something, and find something hidden".
"to have a chat". bintḥakki binṣolaf 12* "we'll have a talk and a chat". Denominative from [948]. For this form of stem III see R 249, EADS 45 and [1357].

ref:
R 44 and Jb 874 sālfa "truce" was unknown in Khābūra; 
Ḥarsūsi sālfeh "story, tale".

L 1122 ṣalan 
"roasted flesh-meat ..."; P sālan, sālnā "curry of meat, fish or vegetables".

def: "a large, round, silver pendant", worn by bedu women and children.
ref: [1083]; W simṭ "string, thread (of a pearl necklace)"; L 1427 simṭ "... necklace, things suspended from necklaces ..."

def: "to try/test out". tistaṣmaġ el-ḥadīṯ/el-akil ... 17 "you test reports/food ..."

obs. "a matchbox". ṣandūq, hēḏe mēl maḫšaṭ 29 "[you put the queen-bee in] a matchbox, you know for matches", said in order to to distinguish it from the pan-Arabic meaning 
"a box [of any sort]", usually larger than a matchbox, which is now commoner than the meaning "matchbox".

ref: W usṭuwāna "column, cylinder ..."; Originally from Greek, as is English stoa.

def:
[a] W.
[b] 21,26 (§ 4.6 example 11) "a side". yigtemʕu gmēʕa, 
il-ʕarab min ṣob wel-niswa min ṣob 11 "[at a wedding-party] they gather together, the men on one side and the women on another"; yā ṣobni! 1 "welcome!/come over here!".

"to listen in, overhear". batṣuwwax mā bayn il-ḥaḍar wel-bedu 30 "I'll listen in to what [passes] between the settled and the nomad"; waṭ-ṭayr itṣawwax yaʕni iṣṭāḫ ʕan in-nebi 17 "and the bird overheard the prophet [Solomon]".
"a dry wind from the south-east" (the direction of Ṣūr).
"a padded rope-harness". An inland word for ḥǣbūl [281].
of earth, "moistness, softness". tirbat il-Bāṭna bihe ṣūma, mo yēbsa 8 "Bāṭina-soil has moistness, it isn't dry [as in. the mountains]".

ref: [159]; [1463]; R (with s, cf. 924); L 1739 i "... to go down from a higher place ... to assault someone", 1741 ṣūba "... anything collected together ..."; S sība (Turkish) "a place surrounded by walls".

def: "to harvest" grain. bansīr unṣayyif iṣ-ṣayf 8 "we're off to harvest the grain"; it-taṣyīf 8 "the grain-harvest".

[a] 12,17 ... "grain". = ḥabb, burr. Sown when summer is over and cut when winter is over. byizirʕu hēḏi ṣ-ṣayf 1 "they would sow this grain".
[b] 1,11*,16* "the season between winter and high-summer", when the grain used to be cut.
= [971b]. tīfēn il-maṣāyif 1 "the season of grain- harvesting".

"a humid wind" from the sea. = [1391]. Unknown 
to 17 and 19.
"a built-up part of a mountain-path" where it crosses a sheer rock. - L 1806 ḍank "straitness".

ref: L 1768 "to roast, scorch something (of a fire or the sun) ..."

def: of livestock, "to get a morning-feed". yḍaḥḥin min ḏēk il-ḥašīš 6 "they get a morning-feed from that grass".

"to give [livestock] a morning-feed". yḍaḥḥīhin
"he gives them a morning feed".
"a palm-garden; a cultivated area". In the mountains, they are usually separate from the ḥāra [364].
ref: R 44 "plot"; W "... outskirts, suburb"; L 1774 "... land outside the town-wall ..."

def: of a plant, "to strike". ḍarbut eṣ-ṣarme 1 "the palm-cutting took". = [226].
* "to clash with each other". fil-awwal dāymen yiḍḍārbu 26 "in the past they were always having battles". Assimilation, cf. W yataḍāraba.
"a glass/plastic phial", for filling a hypodermic syringe. From ḍarab bura 67 "to give an injection".
š-šaḫṣ mustaḍarr 16 "the afflicted person [at an exorcism]".

ref: Jb ṯaġbara; W ḍabara "... to assemble"; H ḍaġdaġa/ṯaġṯaġa "confused speech".

def: "a small palm-leaf basket" for ḥalwa, shaped like a small grāb [227].
[II?—M.D.S.] "to be pregnant". tḍammet [sic] 17 "[the goat] was pregnant".

ref: L 1806-1807 ḍanʔ, ḍanw "children, offspring", I "to hide oneself ..."

def: of animals, "to return [to the pen] at sunset". wḥedhin yaḍwin 23 "they come back at sunset of their own accord".
ref: W "to resort ..."; L 1811 "... to come by night ..."

def: "to bring [animals] back at sunset". ḥad yḍawwīhin 23 "someone brings them back at sunset".
"food received as a guest". - R 283 ḍīfe; W ḍiyāfa.
[a] 7,17,26 [34] "to sink", of a boat/human. [b] "to fill". maṭbūʕ 12* "full to the brim", of a bucket. = [172].

[a] + ʕale/ fī "to be suited/used to". in-nḫīl illi 
yṭābiʕ fil-Bāṭna miṯil Ummusilli 20 "the date-palms suited to 
the Bāṭina Ummusilli"; mṭābʕīn ʕalayh 17* "[we're] used to it (the samsūm-bite)". [b] + fī "to sink lightly into". il-gett mā yrīd mṭāyiḥ wāyid, minšēn bass yṭābiʕ fil-arḍ 9 "lucerne doesn't need a lot of harrowing, just enough for it to sink lightly into the earth".
ref: [a] W ṭubiʕa ʕalā "to have a natural aptitude for ...", ṭābaqa "... to suit ... adapt someone to ..." [b] [1001].

def: "to be alongside something". ana mṭābqinnak inte 17 act.pt. "I'm next to you".
ref: [792]; [999b]; Ḥarsūsi aṭābek "to bring alongside"; W "... to conform with ..."; L 1825 "to put something on top of something the same ..."
[1022]; W ṭābiq/ṭābaq/ṭābāq; L 1827 from Persian; S ṭābaq/ṭābiq.

def: "a cylindrical hive" for Apis mellifera, made from hollowed-out palm-trunk-lengths, two to three feet long.
"to be affected by". kull insēn yenṭarib fiʕluh 16 "everybody is affected by their own deed(s)".

[a] v.t. 17 "to tear something".
[b] v.i. + ʕale 29 "to beg". ṭarrayt ʕalayk ḥāga 17 "I begged something from you".

ref: L 1841 V "... to go to and fro repeatedly ..."

def: "to despatch", e.g. money 1 /someone on a mission. fīh luġa ṭarraštuk fīh luġa ʕannaytuk 11 "'tarrastuk' and 'ʕannaytuk' mean the same (I sent you on a job)".

"to sprinkle" water. ṭišš! 29* imv. One action of sprinkling, ṭišša, comes to mean "a little" 19*,30, most often of liquids, and frequently said in duplicate, ṭišše ṭišše "little by little" or "just a little".
ref: [87]; R 47, 118, 410; Jb 850 incorrectly has tišša; L 1853.

def: "to feed" animals. il-ḥilbe yistaʕmulūh minšēn l-ekil uminšēn ṭaʕm il-ḥaywǣnǣt 9 "they use fenugreek as food [for humans] and for feeding animals"; fīh nēs yṭaʕmuh ḥaywēnēt 20 "some people feed [barley] to animals".

[a] 6,15,25 ... specifically "animal-fodder".
[b] 7*,17 "food", for humans also, through pan-Arabic influence (W).
[a] "to overflow", e.g. of soup on the fire. = ṭufuḥ W. [b] "to hasten away". = ṭār W.
ref: [a] H II "to be overspread with cream (of milk) ..." [b] W "... to leap ..."; H II "... to drive someone away ..."

def: "to remove lumps from, make a tilth of" the earth. taṭfil l-arḍ 17 "you till the earth".
ref: L 1859 "to become soft ... soiled by dust".

def: = I. arḍ muṭaffila sīda 17 "earth tilled level".
"to be tilled, made into a tilth".
"lumps of earth". arḍ shayliyya ma tsuwwi ṭafēl, il-meder ysuwwi ṭafēl 17 "loam doesn't make lumps, clay does".
"tilled earth". cf. [1020] and English "to till" to cultivate, and "till" a stiff impervious clay.

[a] W. [b] 14 (§ 4.6 example 21) "to remove, draw up". iṯ-ṯor mā 
yiṭlaʕ wēgid māy 15 "bulls don't draw much water".
[c] "to go to", bedu usage. 'btiṭlaʕ is-sūq?' 9 "[the 
bedu say] 'are you going to the market?'"

[a] v.i. 8,9 ... "to begin to flower", of a date-palm. "[when the flowers begin to sprout from the ḥīb ([283]), you say] 'ṭallaʕat in-naxle' [or] 'bēn iṭ-ṭalaʕ" 1. [b] v.t. 2 [548] "to sprout", of a lucerne-leaf. [c] v.t. 8,12 ... "to pull out/up". ṯ-ṯor yṭalliʕ il-māy 1 "the bull draws the water"; untalliʕ il-ḥešāyiš barraʕ 9 "we pull the grasses out".
=+ ʕale "to spy on". ṭalaʕt ʕalayk 17 "I spied on you".
"to extract" as payment. An inland word. fil-gebel awwal agīr istaṭlaʕ ʕuḏq ḥǣl bīdār min kull naḫle 12 "the old wage in the mountains was taking one raceme from each palm for the labourer".
ref: L 1869 istaṭlaʕa mālahu "he took away his property".

def: "a generation". hēḏe ṭ-ṭalʕ bu taww ṭāliʕ 12 "this generation which is growing up now".
"a palm-flower", nearly always the yellow female, but sometimes also the white male, which is more usually called nabēt [1503].
"payment in kind to the palm-labourer". An inland word.
[a] * 29 "to unfasten", e.g. a bee-swarm. [b] "to pour". tuṭlig fīhe l-māy 1 "you pour water on to [the palm-cutting]". - H "to give ... something to ..."

"a catchment-hole" for date-syrup (dibs/ʕasal) in the floor of a room. The cropped suḥḥ are piled on matting (gfāra [1312]) over the ṭlāl, left to secrete for a week, and then stamped and packed into ḫṣaf.
ref: [935]; W I "... to bedew (the earth) ..."; L 1863 ṭalal "... place in a courtyard for sitting on ..."

def: "a deep hole", e.g. for burying a donkey.
"to take camels out to graze", and stay with them.
"a camel-herdsman". A herdsman of sheep and goats is rāʕi W.

"to sell a year's date-crop" of a palm or a palm-garden, in advance. ṭannaytak naḫli 17 "I sold you the date crop of my garden"; arīdak tiṭnāni kiḏa kiḏa naḫla 11 "I want you to sell me the crop of so many palms".
"to be obedient, submissive". mustaṭīʕ ile rabbuk yaʕni ḫāši 1 "obedient to your Lord, that is, submissive [during prayer]".
"to be capable of". tuṯmur ʕale qdarhe yaʕni, ʕale mǣ testaṭīq 8 "I mean it fruits as it's able, according to what it's capable of".

"to last". qayẓ il-Bāṭna ṭawwal šahrayn 1 "the 
Bāṭina fresh-date-season lasts for two months".
"to reach, go as far as". ʕaš-šēn yinṭāl it-māy min taḥat 20 "so that the water reaches [the roots] from underneath".
[a] 17 "tilth". sawwa lha ṭola šwayya 21 "work up a little tilth for [the young lime-tree]". [b] 17 "a clay brick". = [1022]. [c] 17* "a measure of weight", e.g. of aloes.
ref: [a] [1021]. [c] P tolā "a weight (especially of gold or silver) of about 184 grains Troy ..."

def: "long". luġethum ṭawwǣle 1 "[the people from Swayq] drawl".
[a] '~an:(uncased) gazra-well-shaft"; "a well" with a diesel-pump. [b] 15*, 26 "a palm-garden", by synechdoche.
ref: [a] 62; W I "... to harbour ... enwrap ..."; L 1899 ṭawīy, pl.aṭwāʔ, "... a cased well ..." from I "... to case (a well) ..." [b] [929b]; [1525].
Jb 836; W "to lose something", ṭawwaḥa bi "... to throw something away ..."; H v.i. "to cast something off".

def: [a] u.t. "to harrow". uṭṭāyiḥhum sīde 20 "and you harrow [the plots] level"; il-mṭāyiḥ 9 [999b]. [b] v.i. *30 "to fall", e.g. of bees from the sky.

[a] a negative auxiliary verb 12* "not to be able to". mā ṭāʕ ymuṣṣ 22 "[the lamb] couldn't suck". = [651a]. [b] v.t. "to agree with". aṭīʕak! 17 in reply to a 
command, "certainly!".
[c] v.i. * "to be feasible". As in the expression of polite 
refusal, mā yṭīʕ 28* "it cannot be", "absolutely not". = ma yṣīr.
ref: [a] Jb 861 "to refuse to"; W ṭāqa "... to be capable of ..." [b] [1039]; W ṭāʕa u "to obey ..."

def: "an opinion" (W), as in ʕaẓunni [ʔaẓunni] 1,6,17 ... "I think", "my opinion is ..."
"to gather". minšēn yẓūl al-meʔ 12 "[they rest between gāzra-shifts] to let the water gather [in the well]"; ẓāyil 17 act.pt.
ref: W ẓalla "... to remain ..." is also current in Khābūra, e.g. ẓāll 9 act.pt.

def: "to gather something". ẓawwelt il-ḥašīš 17 "I gathered up the grass".
"to work on the land for wages". ʕabeṯt 12 "I was a farm-labourer"; il-bīdār illi yaʕbiṯ fil-mazraʕa 9 "the palm-labourer that works on the farm".
of soil, "cultivated". arḍ maʕbūṯe biz-zirāʕa 1 "soil sown with crops". = [294].

[a] "food and water for a long journey". = zēd. [b] "a lift and/or the fare" in a car for someone and/or their 
things.
"I mean", "in other words". Like yaʕni it is often attenuated in meaning and merely fills in a hesitation in speech.
=+ min "to be out of something". aʕabbaṭ min ʕayš 17 "I have no rice" .
"to work". eʕabil fin-naḫal 12 "date-palms are my work".
ref: [1072b]; [1661]; Jb 827 "to clean (ground/ crops etc.)"; Ḥarsūsi ʔābōl yaʔābel "to tend, look after"; L 1941 I, II "... to remove (the leaves from trees) ..."

def: [a] 5 (§ 4.2 example 12),6,29* ... "an empty, uncultivated area". [b] "a newly/seasonally cultivated plot", e.g. without palms, or in the sayḥ for ṣayf, 12. ʕābye gadīde 5,11 "a new garden".
"a gum", of the teeth. hēḏēk ʕugūghe 22 "those are [the goat's] gums".
ʕidda / mʕidda 12 "a gāzra-rope system". ʕidda kǣmla 17 "a whole set of gāzra-ropes".
ref: Wilkinson 73 "the rope from the animals to the mangūr", which is probably bdēn/bdēnēt in Khābūra; W "... rigging, tackle ..."

def: [a] "to fix", W. [b] 8 "to work at something". šū tʕaddal hini? 10* "what's your job here?"
four or six sacks of coarse fabric sewn together into "a container", for transporting limes or dates. Too large for a donkey. A bag carried by a donkey is ḫirg W.
ref: W "either of the two balanced halves of a load carried by a beast of burden; sack, bag".

def: "on a par with; over against, facing".
* "to obliterate". ʕuddemithe ṭ-ṭāyra 30 "the plane annihilated [the bees with chemical spray]".
"except" (W). kull nēs taʕmileh mǣ ʕide l-awlēd iṣ-ṣġār 7 "everyone does it (attends exorcisms) except small chiidren"; maʕde l-Ḥaben 28 "[bees forage on all small plants] except the Oleander".

lex: ʕiḏiq 9 / ʕiḏq 11,12 (§ 4.2 example 4) / ʕuḏq 8,15,25, pl. ʕuḏūq
def: [a] "the whole date-raceme", whether only a little more advanced than the flower-stage ([1028]), or bearing fully ripened suḥḥ. [b] ʕiḏq moz 15 "a hand of bananas".
ref: [a] [1092a]; W ʕiḏq, pl. aʕḏāq "bunch, cluster of dates/grapes". A grape-cluster in Khābūra is ʕunqūd W.
L 1993 adj. "... of established Arab lineage ..."

def: =+ʕale "to sleep with" a woman. lǣkǣn šaḫṣ mʕarras ʕalayhe min qabil 11 "but if a man has slept with her previously", and you (the bridegroom) discover this on the wedding-night, you can divorce her on the grounds that hēḏe l-mara mʕarras ʕalayhe 11 "this woman has been slept with".
ref: R 277 (without ʕale) "to get married"; W ʕurs "marriage ..."; L 1998 (without ʕalā) "... to sleep at night during a journey ..."

def: "a dish of chicken, rice and oil", eaten on the morning of the first day after Ramadan.
"tribal brands", on humans. fī ʕUmǣn mā ysawwu teʕārīf fī gembhum, mā ysawwu nkāriyyēt 17 "in Oman they don't put tribal bands on their side(s), they don't make tribal markings".
ref: [875]; [1091]; [1586]; W "... identifications ..."; L 2013 II "... to brand, stigmatize (for a misdeed) ..."

def:
"to lend". ʕarriqni hēḏi ile mudda ṯlēṯe yom! 11 "lend me this for three days!"; ana aʕarraqik hǣḏa 17* "I'm 
lending you this".

"to borrow". arīd astaʕraq minnak hǣḏa l-ḥāga 17* . 
"I want to borrow this thing from you". - R 177; W istaʕāra.

"a compacted earthen brim" of a gelbe or irrigation- 
channel.
"a round palm-leaf-mat", about three foot across, with two opposite rope-handles. Used either for carrying sticks etc., or as a mat for bowls of food at a meal.
"to snip/brand" part of an animal to show ownership. fīh nēs ʕāzlīnhin 24 "some people do put their mark on [camels]".
[a] "the stalks of the female palm-flowers", and later of the racemes, 1077a. [b] [b] "the raceme" itself, once the dates are removed. When dried it is called ʕaṣu [1102]. ʕasqa one.

[a] 12*,19* "maybe, perhaps", said on its own, cf. W "with following 'an' ..." [b] + verbal pronominal suffixes ʕasǣk bḫayr 12* "I hope you're well"; ʕasinni aslam min hǣḏe s-sigin 17 "maybe I'll escape from this prison".
"a pregnancy", of a goat, sheep or cow, but not of a camel or a human.
ref: W ʕišār "(Egypt) ... pregnant (animal)", also a common word in Khābūra.

def: * "to be mutually attracted". taʕāšáqu huwwa wiyyēha 30 "they fell in love with each other".

ref: [981]; W II "... to give dinner"; L 2055 ʕašāʔ.

def: [a] 2 [239],3,25 "to slash" young lucerne-plants, not yet mature enough for a proper cut, with a mgezz or dass. [b] "to shake the trunk" of a lime-tree, to make the fruit drop. tuʕṣuf al-lūmi 11 "you shake the lime-tree".
ref: [a] L 2063 (of corn). [b] W "... to shake someone thoroughly ..."

def: "a dry palm-raceme" ([1092b]), used for sweeping, harrowing barley-seeds, gathering bee-swarms, etc.

[a] 11 "ill".
[b] 17 "busy looking after someone sick; dealing with a problem".
ref: [a] Jb 845; L 2074 of a disease, "wearying ... incurable ..." [b] W IV "to be difficult ..."

def: "a spike" of the male palm-flower (nabet), placed in the female flower at pollination (tenbīt).

ref: [742]; cf. sitā-phal, P "Sita's fruit, the custard-apple".

def: [a] v.i. 5 = I. [b] v.t. "to make ripe". il-kos ʕaggedhe 3 "the moist sea-wind ripened [the dates]".
ref: L 2104 ... of a plant, "to organise its fruit ..."
W II, IV "... to thicken ..."; L 2107 "... thick (of liquids) ..."

def: "to throw something away". ʕuqquh! ḫalāṣ 21 "throw it away!, [it's] finished".
"a rope" binding a camel's ankle tightly to its thigh, preventing it from standing.
ref: W "cord used for hobbling the feet of a camel ...", which in Khābūra is qayd, pl. quyūd, applying also to goats and sheep; L 2115.

def: "to treat, make better". ma t'elleg 17 "[leprosy] is incurable", passive. Opposite of [1136].
"a piece of wood" held in a gāzra-ox-walker's crooked arm.
ref: [1744]; W I "... to cling ..."; L 2137 "a shepherd's utensil for hanging something on".

def:
W ʕalā. Sometimes shortened to ʕa, e.g. [1054]; 
[1572]; § 6.18.
"to be a caretaker of". hēḏe kēn ʕammār, aʕmur il-bustēn hēḏi, baʕdayn ariggʕah ʕalayh 12 "this is caretaken land. I'm [only] looking after this garden, later I'm giving it back to him".

"self". [a] ma tkūn mgennen bʕumrak 1 "[when] you pray you mustn't be beside yourself". [b] + verbs, reflexive. kelleft ʕomrak 17*, "you've put 
yourself out".
"to argue/squabble with each other". dāymen yitʕānidin 13* "[when you have two wives] they're always at each other".
"a nostril, lobe". ʕanfet il-ḫašm 1 "the nostril"; ʕanfet li-ḏnayn 1 "the ear-lobe"; ʕunf 12 "nostrils"; ʕunf il-manḫara 1 "the nostrils".
ref: Jb 855 naʕfa "nose"; Nautical Kuwaiti ʕanāfa "the curved head of the stern-post of a būm"; W anf "nose ..."; H naʕfa "dependent thong of a sandal", uḏun nāʕifa "dependent ear".

def: =+ b "to be interested in". iʕtinēh buh akṯar ʕan ġayruh 29 "his interest in [bee-keeping) is greater than others".
"I mean", lit. "my meaning". Variants of yaʕni, aʕni, il-maʕne, maʕnǣye etc.
[a] v.t. 10 "to do something again". [b] v.t. * 28 "to put something back". [c] v.i. * 29 (§ 4.6 example 33) "to come back".
ref: [a] W IV. For stem I see § 4.6. [b] W IV. [c] W I.

def: "big, main". ʕūd with this meaning is rare, being usually confined to the W meanings "... branch, twig ... aloes ..."

[a] n. "pain". wisim taḥt il-ʕawar! 15 "cauterise just below the [area of] pain!" 
[b] 7*,11,30 adj. "blind".
ref: [a] R 250 ʕawār "wound"; L 2194 "... weakness ..." [b] W aʕwar "one-eyed".

def: "blindness". inṣen fīh ʕawār mā yšūf 12 "a blind man doesn't see".

ref: [324]; H I "to prowl about by night (man, wolf)".

def: "to make ill". in-nḫīl awwal kēnet mā tʕawwag, al-~zn in-nḫīl ʕawgāne 5 "in the old days, the palms weren't made ill, now they're sick", passive.
ref: [1116]; R 210 + b; W "... to impede, hamper ..."

def: "to be ill", e.g. of mango-trees. muʕtāge 2* act.pt. f.

"last year". bu mil-ʕām 29 "the one from last 
year".
"dried sardines", for human consumption. ʕoma kbār 26 "large sardines".
ref: [1298]; W ʕāma u "to swim ..."; L 2203 "a black insect that swims in the water ..."

def: "to become bare". warag mā šayy, ʕīdǣn kḏī ʕāyret 5 "no leaves, and branches gone bare like this".

ref: W ʕayyār "... scoundrel ..."; L 2207 ʕayarān "doing mischief ..."

def:
"to earn a livelihood". mustaʕīšīn ʕalayhin awwal 
12 "they subsisted off [date-palms] in the past".

ref: R 240; W IV; L 2205 "... to lack power, ability ..."
W aġbar "dust coloured ..."; L 2222 "dust-coloured", transposed from abġaṯ, L 229 "ashy coloured ..."

def: "a fodder" given to livestock on the coast, mainly composed of banana-leaves; date-stones; burnt kereb, palm-thorns and -fibre; and sometimes anchovies. ḥāšay! ġubār mā naʕṭīhin 22 "no never!, we don't give [our animals] ġubār".

ref: L 2228 II "to cover, conceal ..."; H "to be hidden ..."

def: "to be hidden". d-daʕliy fin-nhār mitġabbi, muġtubi 1 "the hedgehog is hidden during the day, concealed".
"to crowd out, smother". hēḏe yġuṯṯ il-gett 3 "this [creeper] smothers lucerne".

"to be overgrown". staġaṯṯ min la-ḥšīš 2 "[the 
lucerne] is overgrown with grass".
"[the] newest leaves" in the centre, e.g. of an onion, lucerne-plant or palm. naḫla ysuwwi ġudr kēbir 17 "a palm puts out large fresh foliage".
ref: L 2232 ġadirat il-ġanam "the sheep became satiated in the place of pasture when in its first growth".

def:
[a] + maʕ 11 "to join a group". aġdif maʕna! 24* "come [inside] and join us!", the inland equivalent of garrib! [1280], which is more usual on the coast.
[b] + ʕale 11 "to break into", e.g. a building; "attack someone".
ref: [a] Jb 830 "to go across". [b] R 129 "to jump up"; L 2233 IV + bi "... to go into (a woman) ..."

def: [a] 11 of time, "ahead". fil-ġādi 17* "in the future"; mil-yom ġādi 28 "from today on". [b] * 29* of place, "over there".
ref:
[a] W ġadan "... on a future day ..." [b] R 113 "distant, far away"; 
Jb 814 "ahead", 840 "further on".

def: "a dry, hot wind" from inland, i.e. a westerly, W.

ref: [1422]; [1428a]; R 255 I "to splash (water) up"; Jb 875 ḫirbāš "turbid"; Mehri ḫárbeś "to put into disorder".

def: of a car, "to get stuck", in sand/mud.
"depth", e.g. of water in a well.
"an inverted siphon" in a water-conduit, short for garrāq fallāḥ 12 "plunger, riser" /"diver, thriver". See Wilkinson 82 for a diagram.

ref: From the name/head of the ruler/war-lord on the coin ?; Jb 852 the name of a Persian coin worth a pie.
[1108]; L 2264 "... fruit when it first comes forth".

def: "a plant" growing in Mekrān, used for plaiting ropes, baskets, etc.
ref: [56]; L 2267 of the palm family; S "... an Indian palm-tree".

def: "to dive down". baġaṭṭ fil-māy 1 "I'll dive down into the water".
"a limit". Verbal noun of I ? ʕale gaṭṭ in-naẓar 3 "as far [out to sea] as the eye can see", lit. (?) "on the diving down of the sight [over the horizon]".
ref: cf. the Nautical Kuwaiti phrase ġaṭṭ il-bill "to cast the lead", "plumb the depth".

def: "to be covered". itkūn itġaṭṭir ʕan iṭ-ṭayr 17 "[you harrow barley-seeds so] they are covered over against birds".
"to come to the surface". sikeʕ fil-māy uġafa yaʕni ṭalaʕ 11 "it sank under the water and then came up".
ref:
R 417 ġaffef and Jc 497 ġaffa "to float". The meaning "to 
sleep", W ġafā u, is understood by 11, but considered an inland word.

def: "to shake". šīl il-gett, ġuffa minhe l-arḍ! 11 "take the lucerne and shake the earth from it!"
ref: W ġaffa ʕalā "to grab someone" (Egyptian); L 2276 ġafā ṭ-ṭaʕām "... he cleared the wheat of refuse".

def: "to alternate". yġālib il-wagt 3 "the weather (lit. time) fluctuates"; mġālibēt 3 "alternations" between humidity and dryness.
ref: W taqallaba. Cf. the Iranian pronunciation of q as g.
[1153]; W "... to roof ...", ġamma "... to conceal ..."; L 2298 "... to cover ..."
[969]; R 6 "gap in a wall"; W "... depression ..."; L 2307 "... hole ..."

def: "intestines", of fish/humans. il-muʕde mutgesseme ġoḍayn 1 "the stomach is divided into two intestines [one for food, one for water]".
ref:
L 2317 ġayḍ "an abortive foetus ..."; cf. 
Persian rūd/rod "... intestines ..." S 592.

def:
[a] 1,17,19 "a storey".
[b] "a course", of concrete bricks. waṣabnǣh dorayn fiṭ-ṭābūq, bedel mǣ kǣn ġāṭ wāḥid sawwayna ġāṭayn 20 "[this time] we lined it with a double course of bricks, instead of a single course we laid two". = [533c].
W "... different from ...", used in duplicate 1,16 ... to express "x is different from y", il-mālid ġayr wel-molid ġayr 7 "'mālid' and 'molid' are two different things".
ref:
Pronounced ġār 
by 6,29,30. cf. Ḥarsūsi ġār "except, only".

def: "[the] flow of water" from a well.

ref:
351; R 415 ġēṭ; Jb 853; W ġāʔiṭ "... faeces"; L 2309 ġāṭa "it sank (e.g. into sand, mud or water)". The word ġayṭ, pl. ġuyūṭ "vestigial clumps of semi wild palms", Wilkinson 56, is unknown in 
Khābūra, cf. [1549].

def: "the writing made at marriage and kept by the woman", guaranteeing her a certain sum if she is later divorced, lit. "the paper of the angry person".
ref:
post Biblical 
Hebrew/Aramaic gēṭ "woman's letter of divorce", Jastrow p.233.

def: "to be angry". Sēlim mustaġīm ʕalayh 12 "Sēlim was angry with him".
"to pick, pluck". tiftik li-qrūn mǣl lūbya 12 "you pick the bean-pods".

lex: faḥal s. / coll. 1 [1501b],8,24 [433] ..., pl. fḥūl 2 / ifḥil 24
def: "a male" camel/goat/sheep/palm, in the sense of being capable of fertilising.
ref: Ḥarsūsi feḥl "penis"; W "male of large animals ..."

def: "to rub [palm-fibre] between the palms of the hand" and make rope. tfidkah 11 "you rub it together".

* "to flower". wal-Qaṣad yfarraḫ noba 29 "the 
Qaṣad-tree also flowers".
ref: [691]; W "... to put out new shoots ..."

def: "a young boy". farḫa, pl. -āt 11 [a] "a young girl". [b] "a hatch/small door" in a window/large door.
"a tassel" at the neck of a dišdǣše.
"flowers", usually of trees, but also of lucerne 25. ferrāḫa 17 [8b] one; fārrūḫāt 30 pl.
a large measure of dry weight.

ref: [416]; W "to separate something ..."; L 2383 "... (of a female animal) to go off at random at the time of giving birth ..."

def: "a semi-nomad encampment; a small ḥaḍar-settlement". hēḏe l-farīq ḥa Beni ʕOf 29 "this hamlet belongs to the Beni ʕOf".

ref: [1210]; W "to rub"; L 2387 "to separate stones from their fruits by rubbing or pressing ..."

def: "a Maria Theresa dollar". = [1285]. As an adj. in hendiadys, grūš frans 3 "Maria Theresa dollars".

ref: L 2393 I v.i. "... to seek aid, to aid ..."

def: [a] 11,26* "to take off' clothing. [b] 7,17 "to remove the date-stone" with the [right-hand] fingers before eating a date.
"to be past". iḏa daḫalet tibēšīr infusuḫ mosem iš-šte 1 "when the season of tibēšīr begins, winter is over".
of a she-goat, "to want the male".
"big", of a she-camel, but not of a cow or goat etc. A bedu word, according to 7.
ref: R 59 of a she-camel, "infertile"; L 2417 "a teething camel ..."

def: "to assess, consider". bafṭan hēḏe uhēḏe, wayš aḥsan? afṭan hēḏe aḥsan 11 "I'll assess these to things. Which is better? I consider this one is".
ref: R 252 "to understand"; W v.i. "... to realise ..."

def: "to commit a big crime", e.g. murder. flēn faʕal urāḥ 11 "x did the evil deed and fled"; fāʕil 11 "a criminal".
ref: L 2420 (and W) "to do"; Swahili feli "... to do harm to someone"; cf. English "before/after the fact".
[1238]; L 2423 faġā u, al-faġw "... to flower ..."

def: [a] v.i. 11 "to snap". = [861c]. [b] "to seize someone's neck from behind" in jest. = [845b]; [861b].
ref: [a] W "to burst ..."; L 2428 II "... to crack, crackle ..." [b] L 2427 "... to crush someone..."

def: of palm-flowers, "to open". tifqi in-Naġāla 25 "the Naġāl-palm's flowers are opening". A variant of [1235].
"to consult in private". nitfākar 11 "we're having a private discussion" .
"to ponder". tistefkur ḥette taʕrif 1 "you reflect to be sure".
"to open", e.g. a door. filtah! 30 "open [the door]!"
= I. ʕalayk it-teflīt 17 "it's your job to unblock [the conduit)".

lex: feleg 9,12,17 ... / fleg 15, pl. aflēg 11* / aflēge 12 / felēga 17
def:
"a water-conduit", running from an aquifer into a settlement. Many are ancient, cf. [528]. Called nahr, pl. anhār, by 8, cf. the 
descriptions of paradise in the Qurʔān.

"a date-stone". From its groove ? cf. W I "to 
split ..."
"to show favouritism to, be unjustly partial towards". fened ʕAli ʕanni ane 11 "he unjustly preferred ʕAli to me".
ref: L 2448 "... to become weak in judgement through age or disease ..."

def: "to ascertain". fennid hēḏe!, saḫle aw tays 1 "ascertain whether this kid is female or male!"

ref: W fanār "lighthouse"; H fanār "paper-lantern ..." Syrian; originally from Greek.

def: "to be finished". fēniš 13*,17* act. pt. "finished; no good".

"to measure". kem fūt il-gelbe hēḏi? madri, mā fawwethe, mā mfawwatinhe 7* "how many feet long is this plot? I don't know, I haven't measured it, I haven't 'footed' it". A secondary formation from [1256].
"to be over". mfēwit rʕi 28 "forage [for bees] is finished [for the year]".
"hearts". fūdethum mā nāṣḥe 6 "their intentions aren't honest".

ref: W fauqu adv. "... on top, above".

def: "to win" a race. filt 11 "I won"; sebeg il-ḫayl fāyil 11 "the horse went ahead [and] won [the race]".
ref: R 207 "to escape"; W fāza; L 2433 falla u "... to defeat ..."

def: "to give someone fruit, coffee, dates and often ḥalwa in the morning".
"morning-food", for a special visitor or a hired labourer.
"at full throttle". makīna šaġġāla fūl 12 "a well-pump working at full throttle".
[a] fīh "there is/are", more common than šayy. mā fīh "there is/are not/none". [b] fī see § 4.5, p.24 above.
"a small metal drum", e.g. for Calor-gas. = [183a].
"to have time". kill ḥad yfīq 29 "everyone who has time [can ...]"
ref: L 2460 of a she-camel, "to have had time to be ready for another milking ..."
Jb 835; L 2461 fwq II "... to delay milking a camel until she is ready".

def: "to have time/leisure". mā mitfiyyiq asāʕadak inte 16 "I don't have time to help you".
ref: L 2461 tafawwaqa "... to do sth. in a leisurely manner".
R 211; L 2463 fuwāq "... resting time between milkings ..."

def: [a] 1,12,15 "a club, staff", formerly used as a threshing-flail [540]. [b] 2* "a female palm-flower". An uncommon synonym of ṭalaʕ [1028].

ref: [627]; R 163 mistakenly has root gbb; W "... dome ..."
L 2477 "... becoming slender in the waist ..."

def: "(any) direction". rūḥ min guble l-gimīn! 1 "go to the right!"; el-ḥuṣn min guble hēḏi 1 "the fort is in this direction". il-quble 11 on its own means "the direction of the Kaaba", W qibla.
"a meal", given to an important guest.

ref: R 75 "fragments"; Ḥarsūsi "coconut-shell", Śḥeri "cooking-pot"; W "... skull ..."; L 2985 "... a glass bowl".

def: [a] 5*,11,30 "to go down into", e.g. a well-housing, "to enter". [b] "to climb up", e.g. a palm 8, "into", e.g. a landrover 5*.

ref: R 115 adv. "in advance"; Jb 814 "an advance of money"; W "to make sth. precede ..."

def: indeclinable adj. of a palm, "bearing ripe dates early in the summer".
"to come in/near", as mainly in the answer to 'hod hod?' [1633], garrib! 1 "come in!"; garribu maʕna! 1 "come and join us!"
"near". qarāyibne 23 "near us"; qarāyib il-bayt 23 "near the house".
"a Maria Theresa dollar", formerly worth 120 baysa, and used as a measure of weight. = [1221].
ref: W "piastre"; German Groschen, originally a small silver coin.
[99]; Ḥarsūsi germōz "fruit of the samr-tree"; L 2987 "a hollow to sit in as proteection from the cold".

def: "a small piece of land; a spot of ground".
"dates" in the fourth of the five stages of ripening, half bisr half rṭab. qārīna 12 / qayrīna 25 one.

[a] "to cut off the old palm-branches" during tibiššera, leaving the stumps "kereb" on the trunk until ḫlēbe [440]. awwal qušǣbe, tquṣṣ il-ḫoṣ il-gābis 9 "first is qušǣbe when you cut off the dry palm-branches". [b] 20 "to pick", e.g. bean-pods. = [1206]. [c] "to clean up". tuqšib iṣ-ṣarma 25 "you tidy up the palm-cutting [before you plant it]"; il-qašb 25 "the weeding [of a fresh plot]".
ref: [c] L 2524 "... to remove qišb from sth., i.e. rust, refuse, anything dirty, dry, hard ..."

def: "the man who cuts off old palm-branches".

ref: Jb 857 gašt "picnic''; EADS 250 Persian; S gašt "... going round, recreation ..."
Jb 817; W qušūr "... refuse ..."; L 2525 qišr, pl. qušūr "... garment ..."

def: "to prune", e.g. vine-branches. Used interchangeably with gaṣṣ W.

[a] pl. qšūš 17,25 [1400], "a self-seeded young date- palm". An inland word. The Bāṭina-equivalent is nešu [1549], Gešš being a particular species of Bāṭina-date-palm. [b] 11 "baggage, belongings". gīb qaššik! 17 "bring your bags!" = [466]; [1293].
ref: [a] H "bad palm-tree ..." [b] W I "to collect something ..."
[424]; Jb 852; W I "... to abrade something"; L 2526 "... to beat with a stick".
Jb 859 "to pull something down"; W I "... to dispel something."

def: "to compose poetry". il-ḥarīm ygiṣdin wāyid 27* "the women compose a lot of poetry".
"a poem". suwwayt qṣīd ḏīk il-yom 30 "I composed a poem that day".
"an inflorescence", e.g. of lucerne, grass; "a seed-head", e.g. of grain.
"a palm-garden". An inland synonym of naḫal [1525b].
"to lop off the upper branchlets of a tall tree", e.g. a ġāfa, for animal fodder.
"a long, wooden-handled tool", with a sharp blade (mūs [1496]) for lopping off high branchlets.
"to snip off", e.g. a little piece of a goat's ear, to show ownership. yqaṭfūhin 23 "they gave them a little nick".

lex: gafīr 2,5 (§ 4.6 example 8),11 / qafīr 8,12 (§ 4.2 example 4),25, pl. agfār 4 / gufrān 3 /qufrān 8,25
def: "a large, palm-leaf / ġaḍaf basket", for carrying dung, rṭab, etc.
"a palm-leaf-mat", through which date-syrup drips into the ṭlāl [1031].

ref: [1325]; Nautical Kuwaiti "fluke of an anchor"; W I "to gather something ..."; H I "to eat something greedily ..."

def: [a] of place, "behind". min gufa l-bayt 5 "behind the house". [b] of time, "after". yom gufa yom 2 "day after day".
"a wooden pulley". manyūr šikl il-guffiye 9 "a gāzra-pulley like a guffiyye. = [537].
ref: Nautical Kuwaiti gufiyya "a block", also South Arabian, with plurals gawāfi and gafāfi; Swahili gofia; L 2463 maḥāla fawqāʔ "a large grooved pulley-wheel ..."

def: "a mountain pool", holding water up to a year after the last rain.
ref: [212]; [410b]: R 12 qill, pl. qlūl; L 2555 pl. qilāt.

def: "to braid" a rope. baglid il-ḥabil hēḏe galāyid, asawwi dirke 1 "I'll plait this rope into braids and make a noose".

ref: W "necklaces ..."; L 2557 qalīd, qild, pl. aqlād.
[177]; R 145 "to support"; Jb 874 "to tow"; W v.i. "to contract ..."
passive of W I, II, VIII; L 2992 VII; H.

def: "to cook", e.g. food in a pan.
"to be insufficient". ma ḥāṣde in-naḫle biṯ-ṯemra, mustagall in-nebēt 1 "the female palm[-flower] didn't develop properly with the male flower, the male palm-flower was insufficient".

ref: Ḥarsūsi; W "rubbish ..."; L 2563 "... small particles of anything ..."
[1313]; R 15 "spoon"; W "... to gather up ..."; P ćamća, ćamas "spoon, ladle".

def: "an onion-flowerheacl". lemme ysawwi qannūb, hēḏe r-roġa ... 20 "when the onion flowers, the bulb here [gets smaller]".
ref: [65]; [1301]; W qanb, pl. qunūb, "calyx"; L 2566 qunnāba "... leaves surrounding the heads of growing corn ..."

def: [II?] "to give someone coffee and dates [and often fruit beforehand]", at any time of the day. gahwayteh? 11 "have you given him coffee and dates?"
[V?] "to have coffee and dates, etc." bintqahwa awwal 12 "we'll have coffee and dates first".
"one of", a plant, tree. hini gora hinēk gora 2 "one [lucerne-]plant here and one there", i.e. thinly distributed.
ref: [277]; [878]; L 2574 qāra "a small mountain separate from others ..."

def: "to finish and depart". qawwuḍ šuġlak! wayn inrūḥ? lis-sūq. 11 "finish your work and [let's] go!" "where ?" "we're off to the shops". maḥlin, qawwaḍ el-mā ʕalayhin 12 "[the wells] dried up, the water left them".
ref: R 211 "to finish (a job); .Jb 859 "to prepare (for a journey); W "... to strike (a tent), break off something ..."

[183]; [1346]; Jb 822; W qauṭa "... date 
basket"; S qūṭī (Turkish); P qūtī "box (of wood or silver) from Persian.

def: (omission of l) gut lik 13*, "I told you".
"a stand", of a crop. qomat il-qatt ḍaʕīfa 20 "[in high summer] the lucerne-stand is weak".
of a palm, "to produce ripe dates".

[a] 11,17 = I. Qašš Zebed ḫlēf Ummusille bwǣgid, min qayyiẓ Ummusille layn yqayyiẓ Qašš Zebed ... 15 "the Qašš Zebed palm is well after the Ummusille palm. From the former producing ripe dates to the latter doing so [is over two months ...]" [b] * 26 "to be [somewhere] for il-qayẓ". gayyaẓna šahrayn 27 "we stayed two months while there were ripe dates to be had".

[a] 8,11,26 ... = rṭab, "dates in the final stage of ripening". mā šayy gayẓ wāyid fili-Mṣīra 27 "in Masira there aren't many ripe dates". [b] 1,11,17 (§ 4.6 example 22) ... "the season when the dates ripen, high summer" (W).
ref: [a] [280]. [b] [971b]; cf. ḫarīf W "autumn ...", and L 726 "fresh ripe dates ..."

def: =+ maʕ "to spend the ear]y afternoon resting with someone", but not sleeping (W).

ref: W qawwama "... to raise something ..."; H qawwama (Syrian).

def: "a tin". mkebbet Nīdo 30 "a tin of Nido (dried milk)".
ref: [183]; [1334]; R 272; Swahili mkebe; W kabba " ... to pour out ..."
L 2586 also "nobleman", as in tawāraṯu l-maǧda kābiran ʕan kābir "they inherited nobility one nobleman from/after another"; cf. [596].
R 162; L 2588 I "... to put (the head) into garments ..."

def: "a [traditional] dish of rice, meat and vegetables", given to important guests.

ref:
W I "to take a handful ..."; H 
kabša "... scummer" (Syrian).

def: [a] ketel/aktal11 a.dj. "round". [b] ketel 11 / ketli 13* n. "a kettle".
ref: [a] Jb 863; W I "... to press something into a lump"; L 2998 mukattal. [b] [1191]; Jb 848 via Hindi from English; P ketli English.

[804]; [1363]; R 6 kādli; Jb 819 quotes Hindi (as P) and Gujerati khāṭlū "bedstead"; Nautical Kuwaiti kātli "the bench on the poop on which the noḫḏa (see [1523]) sleeps. From the Portuguese cátele; P khāṭ "bedstead, cot ..."; HJ 264, Tamil and Malayalam 
kaṭṭil, adopted by the Portuguese.

def: "widespread, abundant, many", sometimes used with keṯīr for extra emphasis, "very many".
"to lie habitually". Intensive of W I.

[§ 4.2 example 8] "stumps/bases of palm-branches", whether left on the trunk during qušǣbe, or cut off during ḫlēbe. Used for fuel; fodder [1150]; net-floats, before the days of polystyrene; etc. kerbe one.
"a gāzra-rope", going from the bucket to the rišé over the mangūr.
ref: [59]; R 71 pl. krūr; L 2601 karr, pl. kurūr/akrār, "rope for climbing a palm-tree, or fastener of a camel-saddle"; H "... cable".

def: "to heap up earth into ridges". nikriz il-arḍ awwal bēdi 9 "first of all we heap up the earth into ridges". Denominative from [1361].

"a tool for heaping earth into a ridge", which is then compacted to become a waʕb. It has a rectangular metal blade 18 in. x 9 in. fixed, longer side horizontal, but a collar [289] to a 3ft. long wooden handle. One man pushes down on this handle while another opposite pulls the blade across towards him by a rope attached to the collar, thus scooping the earth into a ridge.
ref: S kurz "a field prepared for sowing, having a raised border round it".

def: "a small bag", e.g. for a copy of the Qur'an. An inland word.

ref: [804]; [1354]; EADS 56; P ćār-pāʔi "bed", ćār-pāya "four-footed ..."; HJ 185 from Persian chihār-pāī.

def: "a lot", e.g. of twenty-four poles piled together.
"an iron- bladed, wooden- handled tool", for digging holes, used and shaped similarly to a Dutch hoe.
"to raid". beled kisbit beled 11 "one village attacked another". obs., the W meanings "to earn, obtain" are now more common.
"to fold", e.g. the wings when not flying. bayiksif yinēḥeh 1 "[the bat] will fold its wings"; maksūf 1 "clipped", of the Khābūran accent, as opposed to that of Swayq, which is mamdūd "drawled".
ref: W "... to be eclipsed ..."; L 2611 kasara ǧanāḥayhi "(the bird) contracted his wings (to alight) ..."; L 277 kāsif ul-bāl "straitened in hope"; H "... to hock (a beast)" .

def: "a mattress-cover; a palm-leaf sack" for suḥḥ. = [428].
of an animal's hair, "to stand on end".
"patterned linoleum". After the Persian Kāši/Kāšāni tiles, see Encyclopedia of Islam, 2nd edition, article "Kāshī" (C.Adle).

"to place one foearm over the other in front of the stomach" in prayer. is-Sinni yikfit īdayh wel-ʕIbāḍi lē, yūqaf sīde 26 "the Sunni folds his forearms, but no the ʕIbāḍi, he stands [with arms] straight down".
ref: Ḥarsūsi kefōt "to kneel with one's feet tucked under one"; W "... to hold back"; L 2619 "... to draw sth. together to oneself ..."

def: "to fill up" with liquid. layn stikfit il-makīna 12 "until the [well-]pump is full [of water]".
"bother". ma šayy kellūfa! 18* "no trouble at all!"
= [1379]. A variant of the common teklīf (W), cf. Wright 1 115.

ref:
432; 1451; Harsiisi 
ke'lat "swollen testicle"; W kulwa "kidney"; S kulah " ... membrum .virile".

def: [a] W. [b) "a few, several". bʕīd ʕan Maṣīra kem mayl 1 "several miles away Masira". More often kemmayn 23,30 ... baʕd kemmayn yom 21 "after some days". Perhaps from kem min ...

[a] 11 W.
[b] "to heat". kemmedt il-māy 11 "I heated the water".

ref: R 273; W I "to cover ... muzzle"; L 3003 kumma, pl. kimām, "round cap".

def: "a small recess" in a wall, for Apis florea to nest in.
ref: [646]; L 2634 "an animal's covert, abode or cave".

def: "gravel" of the size needed for concrete.
ref: [796]; P kankar; English "kunkur" is also from Hindi, HJ 496.

def: "to be heaped up". nyūm mitkawwde 1 "a constellation".

ref: H kūra "... forehead" (Egyptian); see also root kry.

def: [1109] "dew, mist humidity; a moist wind from the sea (= north-east)".
ref: [974]; [1164]; [1424]; Swahili kusi "... south monsoon"; H "contrary wind"; S "... the north-west wind".
[841b]; P; HJ 249f. discusses other possible etymologies, one Turkish.

def: [239] conjunction "if". More often combined with in, inkēn 17,23 inkēn sēʕa wāḥde inte batsīr, thabbuṭ ṯinayn ṯilēṯ dihdayh dihdayh 6 "if you were to go at one o'clock you would sell two or three [bundles of lucerne] immediately".
"to cauterise". ykawwi bin-nār 9 "he brands, using fire".
"on the contrary!; indeed yes!" An interjection contradiction a negative or a doubtful question. Similar to W balā.
"to heap up". nkayyid ul-qatt 25 "we pile up lucerne".
"a small measure of dry weight". il-kīlo sitt kīsēt 2 "there are six kyǣs to the kilo".
"accord", as in qšūš tiṭlaʕ min kayfhe min il-arḍ 25 "wild palm-seedlings sprout from the earth of their own accord".
ref: W "... option, will ..."; H ʕala kayfihi "as it pleases him" (Syrian).

def: "a spathe/pod of the male palm-flower", emerging from the ḥīb (cf. [229]) and when old and dry, called šaġrāfe [839].
"to light; be alight". el-layt lābuq 26* "the headlamp is on".
"colostrum", e.g. of a goat, cooked with Ṣaʕtar (W "wild Thyme") and salt, for human consumption. Many people wrongly think that the colostrum is harmful to newborn animals, cf. [791].
ref: [734]; L 2644 libaʔ "biestings ...", labaʔa l-labaʔ "he prepared and cooked biestings".

def: "a gum", of an animal or human.
"a large round cistern", in a feleg-system. An inland word.
ref: R 43; Wilkinson 89 originally al-ijl; cf. L 24 ajila "to be delayed, kept back ..." and H maʔjal ul-māʔ "swamp".

def: "a gazelle-horn, overlaid with silver", for carrying gunpowder.
"to be sticky", e.g. of diseased lucerne.
ref: W I; L 2659 talazzaja n-nabātu "the herbage became flaccid and mucilaginous ..."
Jb 846; L 3009 "... to hold fast to (a debtor) ..."

def: "to sting", of an ant or bee. lesbak 1 "[the bee] stung you".
"a burning", e.g. on the skin from Saffron.
of an animal, "nasal mucus; a runny nose".
ref: [1453]; W I " ... to slobber ...", luʕāb "... slaver ..."
L 2663 "... a player, gamer by profession".

def: of water, "turbid", e.g. at first strike when digging a well.
ref: [1165]; Jb 863 lāġiš "roughness (of sea)"; W ġabiš "... opaque ..."

def: "to speak". hēḏe yilġā bilaġúh hēḏe yilġā bilaġúh 19 "Everyone speaks in their own way".

Through outside influence the meaning "a foreign language" is now current in Khabura, but the old term for that was rṭina, and luġa meant, and still means, "a word". [a] simply, mā fīh luġa ʕindna ismuh 'qaʕaṭ'' 11 "we have no word 'qaʕaṭ'"; 'marbūš' 'mġarbaš' nefs il-laġa hiyyilleh 11 "'marbūš' and mġarbaš' are the self same word". [b] as a synonym, fīh luġa ygūl 'ḫūz' fīh luġa ygūl waḫḫar' 11 "'ḫūz' and 'waḫḫar' mean the same"; 26 described nyūm, nǧūm and ngūm as luġāt. [c] as a homonym, fīhe luġetayn maʕne daʕne umaʕne l-arḍ 1 "['daʕne'] is two words, one meaning a sheet made from palm-leaves, and one the ground"; 'kuššeh!' luġa ṯēnye 11 "'chase him off!' is a homonym [of 'kušše' a lock of hair]".
"a trap", for foxes, built of stones and with a small entrance. The bait is put inside.

ref: H lijāf, pl. aljifa, "threshold of a door".

def: [a] 1,11* "to say prayers [over the dead] in a special tone of voice". [b] "to be spokesman for". alaggin Nāṣr bil-kalēm 1 "[Nāṣr is ill so] I'm speaking on his behalf".
ref: [a] W "... to whisper ..." [b] W "... to dictate ..."
R 143 I "to seize"; H "to tap so. slightly ..."

def: of a young animal, "to suck from". yilkaʕ ummuh 11 "it's sucking from its mother". Less common than [602].
ref: H "... to bump the head against its mother's udder (suckling)".

def: "to sparkle". yitlāmiʕ ziyy il-māy 17 "[the mirage] sparkes like water".
"a word, expression". hēḏēk nefs il-lahḍa 11 "that's the same expression", said of a synonym.
"to shake". ylawwiḥ rāseh kel-megnūn 7 "[the medium] shakes his head like a madman".
ref: W v.i. + bi "... to swing, wave something ..."

def: "to swing, move to and fro", e.g. of too light a pendant 12 in-ngūm ykūn yitalawwáḥin min hēḏe l-ḫuṭṭ lil-āḫr 17 "the stars swing from this quarter to the other".
"to befall". minšēn mā ylūfhe šayy 22* "[the amulet round the camel's knee is] so that nothing [bad] befalls her".

ref: W lawan "gripes, colic ..."; H "... winding, contortion ..."
[231]; [1412]; [1655]; Donaldson "a general name for fishing nets".
[1254]; see also root mwtr; through English.
[742]; Swahili mchungwa. The word probably came from East Africa to Oman, rather than vice versa. It is absent from S, P and HJ.

def: "a disease", mainly of date-palms, but also of lucerne and onions, causing a sticky secretion.
"drouthy". ṣāret blēdīnhum meḥlāna min qillet il-amṭār 17 "their villages dried up from lack of rain".
"to set out", e.g. of fishing-boats 26; "to abscond", of bees 23*,28. A bedu word according to 1,9. 'hatmidd ile l-Bāṭna?' 9 "'you'll be setting off for the Bāṭina?'" (mimicking the bedu lilt).

ref: W "clods ... loam, clay"; L 2698 "... compact/cohesive earth/clay ..."

def:
"to make [camels] lie down". marraḥūhin ḥetta ynūḫin 1 "they make them lie down to rest". Denominative 
from [1460].
"a dry place for the camels to rest", not too near the human sleeping-quarters.
ref: R 50 "empty place", marwāḥ "drying-place"; W (root rwḥ) "place visited in the evening ..."

def:
[a] 5,12 (§ 4.6 example 19),15 (§ 4.4 example 9) ... "again". [b] 2,15,26 682 ... "once". [c] 17 (§ 4.6 example 3),20 "at one go/time". [d] "at once". timtizir marra 6 "[the bucket] fills up 
at once"; ṣār ṭayr rawwaḥ marra 17 "he was a bird, and went off at once"; marra sīda [789b] "immediately". [e] coupled with an adj./adv. for emphasis, cf. English "simply". wegeʕ šadīd marra 12 "a very strong pain"; marra aḥla ʕan ḥelwa 20 "far sweeter than ḥalwa"; marra gmīʕ § 4.6 example 46 "close together"; sīda marra [789b] "straight ahead"; marra mamzūr ila fog 2 "completely filled to the brim"; mustaʕiddīn marra 16 "we're fully prepared"; zayy il-gǣhil marra 17 "exactly like a child"; min tiṭlaʕ iš-šems ilayn tislam, marra eṣfūn 17 "from sunrise to sunset, continually at attention"; § 4.6 example 15. [f] marra marra 7 "bit by bit'. = [653].

ref: [1083]; R 388 murrīye; L 2701 marīra, pl. marāʔir "... a long and slender rope, a strand of rope ..."

def: "a roughly built stone house; a hill-top look-out". An inland word.
"to make ill". hǣḏi l-Bīḏām ayš ymarḍah? 6 "[take] this Bīḏām-tree [for instance], what's making it sick?"
now has the pan-Arabic meaning "disease, illness", but according to 17,19 it originally meant specifically "leprosy", and marīḍ meant what is now magḏūm (W).
"to fill with water". umzirhe māy! 2 "and fill [the hole] with water!" yismek yimzir 1 "[when you drink] your body fills with water".
[a] v.t. "to sweep". misḥ ul-bayt bil-ʕaṣu! 1 "sweep the house with the dry palm- raceme!" [b] v.i. + ʕale 2 (§ 4.2 example 14),25 "to harrow in [lucerne-seed] lightly by hand".
ref: [a] [50]; W "... to clean ..." [b] [91]; W "to stroke with the hand ..."

def: "a woollen rug", placed in a Semr-tree by bedu for shade.

[a] 21 ... "to go,walk" (W). Considered by 7,11 to be slang and obsolete for the modern rāḥ. mšayna! 17 "let's go!"; bil-meši 16 "on foot". [b] 13*,16 "to get sold"; "be viable", of currency. weddayt es-sūq hēḏi, miši 9 "if you took this [vegetable-crop] to the shops, it would go".

[a] 8 "to tread something". ṭarīq maššāy, yaʕni meššūh ʕale rgūlhum we ʕale boš 17 "a trodden path, that is they had trodden it down on foot and camels". [b] "to do something hastily". mešši š-šuġl! 1 "do a quick job of it!"; suġl maššāy 17 "a rushed job".
"a seedling", about to be or being transplanted from the seed-bed. Used of tomatoes, onions and sorghum but not of garlic.
"to be stretched out". mitmáġġaṭa ʕale ṭūlhe, yēbse 12 "[a she-goat] stretched out the length of her, stiff".
[a] 1 "to upset something", e.g. a glass of water. [b] 24 "to jerk something downwards", e.g. in castration.
ref: [b] W "... to toss down"; H "... to suck (its mother, of a young one)".

def: adj. or I passive, "overturned". maggaʕteh fī yidi ṣār mugʕ 1 "I upset it in my hand, it got overturned".
=+ ʕale 1 of a bridegroom, "to marry, wed".
ref: R 270 VIII; W v.t. "... to take possession of ..."

def: "a wedding-declaration", recited in front of the bridegroom and witnesses, and including the phrases 'flēn bin flēn baystemlek ʕale flēne bint flēn'.
"a china bowl", used for keeping coffee-cups under water.
ref: [726]; [918]; Jb 822 "large bowl"; P malla "... vessel for drinking, cup ..."
[1038]; S mullā "school-master ... learned man ..." (from Arabic mawlā ?)

def: temporal conjunction, W munḏu [a] 22 [337],24 54 "since", shortened in mis-snīn 12*,16*,29 ... "years ago" . [b] 1 [582],9 [240],15 (§ 4.4 example 9) ... / men 2 [548],5 (§ 4.2 example 12) "once", shortened in meyidḫal is-sebʕīn 5 "once the seventy-season has begun".
relative/interrogative pronoun, W man, 1 [174] "he who; who?" shortened in minte? 17 "who are you?"

W. Often shortened, [160]; [376b]; [597]; mil-ʕiḏq 17 "from the raceme"; mil-ʕAyn 18* "from el-ʕAyn"; and in compounds mʕind 17 [449],29 [1728] "in times of"; mhayn 6 [1656] "wherever"; baʕd miyʕaqid 20 "after [the onion-bulb] has matured". The nūn doubles with pronominal suffixes beginning with a vowel, [1491].

[a] 2,9 ... "here", probably from min hini [1630a]; "from here" 12 (§ 4.6 example 16). [b] "from now". minni layn ḫamstāšr yom 5 "from now for another fifteen days". [c] minni uminni 6,8,9 [1545] ... "here and there", "all over the place". minna uminna 12,17 (inland pronunciation).
"mung-beans", smaller and later to fruit than lūbya, and eaten dried. = mǣš W.
ref: L 2689 maǧǧ; HJ 580 moong, Hindi mūng, "a kind of vetch in very common use over India".

def: "to take milk" from the mother-animal; "to take nourishment" from the earth, of seedlings 17 tmennaḥ minnah 21* "[the kid] drinks from her".
ref: L 2737 I "to lend someone an animal to take the milk yield ..."

def: "a good milk-yield". sē bu fīhe minḥ 29 "a good milch-goat".
ref: W "... giving ..."; L 2737 minḥa "... a gift of milk ..."

def: a measure of dry weight, "a maund". One menn Mesqaṭ = five menn ʕUmān, and ten menn Mesqaṭ = one frāsle.
ref: [150]; R 196; W "... two raṭl"; P; originally from Akkadian? HJ 563.

def: [a] interrogative pronoun, W mā? 1. "what?" mo trīdna nsawwīh? 17 "what do you want us to do?" Contracted in mismeh 9,11* "what's-its-name". [b] 17 [380] relative pronoun, W mā 2. "what." [c] 8 [964] negation, W mā 4. "not". mo zayn 13*, or with bi, mo bzayn 13* "not good".
[a] *28,30 "a car". = [794]. [b] "a well-pump". el-ḥīn yrikkibu mawātīr 20 "now they install well-pumps".

[a] n. 1*,16 (§ 6.18),23* "property" (W), "a palm-garden; a riding-beast". [b] hence used in place of the construct 11 [1], 12 [307] ... tartīb mǣlak 17* "it's up to you". [c] with material, to replace an adj. 1 [1170],12 [932]. [d] prep. 13*,29 [955],30 [818] ... "for, containing". [e] bayt mǣl 17* "government-owned property".
ref: [a] [346]. [b] [376a]. [d] [335c]. [e] R 64 bēt lmāl; W bait al-māl "(public) treasury".
Ḥarsūsi mūl "(not} at all"; p (dialect) mul "... at all, in the least ..."
R 27 mēz; S mez, mīz; originally from Portuguese mesa.

def: [a] 8,12 (§ 4.3.5) ... of a human, "to pollinate" the female palm. it-tenbīt "pollination". passive 5 (§ 4.2 example 13). [b] of a male palm, "to fertilise" the female. il-faḥal ynebbit in-naḫīl "the male date-palm fertilises the females". [c] *29 of a queen-bee, i.e. šayḫ, "to impregnate" worker-bees.

ref: [115]; R 159 "to search"; W v.i. "to search, rummage ..."; L 2758 "... to disclose ..."

def: [a] v.i. 20 (§ 4.6 example 25) "to ripen". [b] v.t. * = W I "to bear ..." hū ynetguh fiṭ-ṭafḫ 29 "[the sayḫ / queen-bee] lays [the eggs] in the brood-comb".

"to reach the bottom" of the ox-walk, and so pull up the bucket. hinēk yintaḫ, ṭalaʕ il-māy, tšarraʕ il-māy waragaʕ huwa 12 "[the bull] reaches the bottom [of the ḫabb], up comes the water, out it's poured and [the bull] comes back up".
"to serve" the female, of a goat/sheep. = [63b].
"to be fully ripe", e.g. of a grass-seed 17*, of dates 25.
[a] "a wooden-pulley", sitting on the gāzra-derrick's cross-piece ([621]), made by a carpenter (naggār). [b] 6*15,17 by synechdoche, "a [complete" gāzra".
"to be uncooperative in work, refuse to work".
[a] v.t. "to create trouble for". ynēḥis rabʕah 1 "he makes things difficult for his fellows"; ynēḥishum bil-kelǣm 1 "he argues with them". [b] v.i. (ʕan il-ʕamil) 1 = I.

ref: H naḥūṣ "yielding no milk from fatness (of a she-ass)".

def: "to become dry". naḥaf il-makǣn 17 "the place dried up".
"dry", e.g. of earth, wind, fruit. iḏa ṣāret il-arḍ nǣḥfa mā fī-ha māy 9 "when the soil is dry, it has no water".
obs. "a captain" of a boat; "a foreman", on land.
ref: R 177; Nautical Kuwaiti "master"; H nāḫuḏā, pl. nawāḫiḏ "ship-captain (Persian)"; S nāḫuḏā "... captain of a ship".

def: v.t./v.i. "to go out to; move round to", e.g. of the summer-sunset 23*. yom yindar is-seḥ 30 "when [the bees] go out to the desert-plain"; to come out from", + min 30.
"to make come/go out". il-maʕrūf yneddur il-ġūl min serebuh 7*,11*,16 "kindness brings the snake from its hole".
"to remove" part of something. nezzayt warqa min il-kitǣb 17 "I took out a page from the book".
ref: W nazaʕa, bazza; H + ʕan "to part with".

def: "to remove parts from". ynezziz hēḏe r-rubṭa, ynuṭṭufhe 17 "he takes bits from the bundle, he picks at it".
"to use a minzifa". ynizfu 20 "they drew water by shadoof".
ref: W "... to empty ..."; L 3031 "to exhaust entirely (the water of a well)".

def: "a manual counterpoise-lift", for irrigation, "a shadoof", used in the mountains before diesel-pumps.
"to go down". Intensive of I, not just causative as in Ja 675 and W.
"to puff and pant". yināsḫin 17 "[the she-goats] pant heavily [in the heat]".
[a] = III. yitnassáḫin 17. [b] 17 of weeded plants, "to have room/breathing-space".
ref: [a] [1671]; W tanassama "to blow, breathe ..." [b] W "to be deleted ..."
Jb 827 "coarse cloak"; Ḥarsūsi "woollen cloak"; Swahili mansuli "woollen clothing/coverlet"; W I "... to unravel ..."
[811]; Jb 861; R 222 "to set free"; H "to free (a slave)".
R 280 "plot"; W I "... to break out (war)".

def: "to sprinkle", e.g. powdered dung on to watered soil. tinšaḥ is-samǣd foq il-māy 25 "you sprinkle the manure on top of the water"(i.e. directly after irrigation, before the water has actually sunk away). Sprinkling it on dry soil is il-ʕafr, W.
ref: L 2792 "... to give (a camel) a little water to drink ..."

def: [a] vt "to question someone". ane banšidak min ayy qabīla inte 16 "I would ask you which tribe you were from". [b] vi + ʕan "to ask after someone's health". mā nišed ʕannak, kiḏi rawwaḥ 6 "he didn't ask after you, he went off just like that".
[a] 11,30* "to depart". = [895]. [b] 12 "to come to life", e.g. of a newly-born animal at first motionless.
ref: [a] W vt "... to spread ..." [b] W vt "... to resurrect so. from the dead ..."; L 2794 "... to come to life ..."

def: "thickness". yibga l-ʕūd ile nišaṭ iṣ-ṣabʕ 5 "the brach remains to the thickness of the finger". = [1698]. Unknown to 17,29. Balūši?
"to be loose, friable". tniššil il-arḍ 17 "the soil is crumbly".
"to splay/fan out". mā yetneššil minni uminni 9 "[if you tie down the date-raceme] it doesn't splay out in all directions".
[§ 4.4 example 7] "to recover, fill out". intišil il-gett fiš-šte 1 "lucerne recovers in the winter".
"crumbly". arḍ nišla mā fīhe ṭafēl 17 "friable earth with no lumps".

ref: [1295a]; the word ḫīs "self-seeded palms", Wilkinson 71, is unknown in Khābūra, cf. [1199].

def: [a] 7,11 "to pull", e.g. a reluctant goat. = [177]. [b] 11 "to do something evenly/justly".
ref: [a] L 2797 "to raise ... move sth. ..." [b] W anṣafa.

def: "to put out leaves". fiš-šte ytemm šahr mā ynaḍḍar 2 "in winter it remains a month without leafing". = I (W).
"to pick". btākleh menṭūf min ummah 5 "you'll eat it [freshly] picked from its palm".
[886b]; [1181] "to see" (W). bʕayni mā naẓarthum 12 "I didn't see them myself". = [560].

ref: R 51 mnaẓẓaf; W "... to become clean ...", ṭahhara "to clean ... circumcise".

def: of a he-donkey, "noisily to want the female". Onomatopoeic.
of a human or jinni, "to talk in tongues", at an exorcism.
ref: W II, IV "... to inspirit so."

def: [a] 7,16,26 ... "an exorcism". [b] 16 "a party", at a girl's circumcision.
"a medium". in-naʕʕāš ṣāḥib mālid 7 "the medium is the leader of a seance".
"a wind", from the direction of the constellation naʕš (which rises NNE and sets NNW, Donaldson).

inʕamt biz-zawēg? 11 "are you pleased with the marriage". This is the traditional question put to the bridegroom the day after the wedding, and to which he should reply yinʕam ʕalayk wil-ḫayr! 11 "[God] make you happy with good things!"
"to get a breeze". l-arḍ mā yinēm fīhe, lēzim ḥad yertifiʕ ʕaš-šǣn tneffaḥ 12 "one doesn't sleep on the ground, you need height to get a breeze".
"to fill out", e.g. of a growing child.
ref: W I "... to inflate ...", VIII "... to be inflated ..."; L 2821 "... to become inflated, swollen ..."
[390]; R 61 "room (space)"; W nafs "... life ...", nifās "... childbirth ..."; L 2828 nafs.

def: "a large, round, shallow basket", made from plaited ʕasaq [1092], and used for catching and gathering dates.
ref: W "sieve ..."; L 2832 "garment on which the fruit of a tree falls, vessel in which dates ... are shaken to remove the dust, etc."

def: "to give alms from". ma had yenfughin 6 "no one gives alms from [palms now]"; awwal il-uwādim yom ḍāmm ġuwāzi tunfug minhe 6 "in the old days, when they collected some cash, people would give alms from some of it".
"to pull up large roots from the soil". = [603].
"to scarify". tnaqqiš il-arḍiyya 17 "you scarify the soil".
ref: W "... to engrave ..."; L 2840 I "... to scratch, lacerate (skin/fruit) ..."

def: "a metal rake", for scarifying the soil.

ref: [447]; [1553]; W vt "... to break ..." ; L 2842 IV "... (of the earth) to put forth plants ..."

def: "to fire", of a gun; "burst", e.g. of a tyre.
"tribal brands", on humans. (Unknown or unintelligible to outsiders?) = [1084].
"to walk seawards"; "to start down", e.g. of an animal on the ox-walk. nikas ḥādir 1 "he went seawards" (a hendiadys by way of explanation).

ref: W "... fragrance ..."; L 3038 "the odour of the mouth"; H "foul breath ..."

def: "a sort, kind". hēḏe n-namūne 2,12 / hen-namūne 3,10,23 "like this", sometimes as an isolated interjection "that's how it is" [§ 4.6 example 1]; ġayr namūna 17* "[such and such] is different".
ref: W namūḏaj; L 2852 "namūna a vulgar Persian form of namūda from which comes the arabic namūḍaj"; S namūna, namūdār "... example, specimen ..."

def: "daily". yišrab fin-nahāriyya ṯnayn marra 23 "it drinks twice daily"; nahāriyya yisqi ḫamsa gelba 15 "it waters five plots a day".
"to awaken someone". rūḥ warrag Sʕīd! rūḥ nahḍah! 11 "go and wake Sʕīd! go and awaken him!"

ref: R 279 "to call so.", 263 "to peal", of thunder; L 3039 nahīm "a chiding of camels"; H "to chide (camels), to roar (lion) ..."

def: [a] 1,17* [1459] of camels, "to lie down to rest". [b] + ʕale 1 [1612] of a he-camel, "to mount" the female.

[a] "to make [camels 24,27 / cattle 25*] lie down". [b] "to let [the he-camel] mount" 23 [66b]; "let [the she-camel] be mounted". nawwiḫt ane nāgti, ane mnawwaḫinhe ams 1 "I had my she-camel served yesterday".
ref: [a] [1459]; W "to halt for a rest ..."; L 2864 only of camels.

def: "a teat", of a camel, goat or sheep.
"no". An inland word, uncommon in Khābūra, and opposite of hay [1644]. According to 7, in Swayq and Khadra further down the Bāṭina, āhā means "yes".
"a hand-spade" with a three-inch-wide blade and a wooden handle 2 to 3 ft. long.
ref: [727]; L 2873 I "... (of a sword/spear) to penetrate into, cut sth. ..."
Jb 858 hubur / hibār "(medicinal) plaster"; W jabara, jabbara.

def: "to take [food]". ma hebeštu? 5 "haven't you started [eating yet]?"; most commonly heard in the imperative from the host hbiš / hibšu! 4*,19*,24 "help yourself!" "fall to!" s./pl.
[a] vt + is-sūq 9*,11* of humans, "to go down to the shops". [b] vi 16*,17,29* of a wadi, "to flow".
ref: [a] W "... to go to a place ..." [b] [759]; Jb 832; W "to descend ..."
[1252a]; W I "... to attack ..."; H "... to overthrow (a building) ..."

def: of a she-goat 25*, "noisily to want the male'. il-ġanam yhiddin 13* "she -goats are noisy when they want the male"; of a he-camel, "noisily to want the female". il-gemel hēdd, yrīd ynūḫ ʕāle n-nāge 1 "the camel is rutting noisily, he wants to mount the female". A variant of [1613].
ref: L 2882 (of a camel) "to bray", 2873 habba (of a he-goat/camel).

def: of a he-camel, "noisily to want the female".
ref: [128]; W "... to bray ... bellow ..." For hūdār see [497].
[947]; R 246 harge "talk", 164 III "to talk to so."; L 2890 "... to talk a lot ..."
[680]; R 178; H "... to suffer from diarrhoea ..."

def: [a] 2* "very". hest ḥelu 14 "very sweet". [b] "many/a lot." ṣār ḥadīṯhum fīh ġalāṭāt hest 17 "there are many errors in the speech [of the people from the Šarqiyya]"; šwayy šwayy mā fīh hest 12 "just a little, not a lot".
"to fall down". inte thaššemt min foq 15 "you fell down from on top".
ref: W "... to be destroyed"; L 3043 "(a plant) became dry and broken in pieces".
R 142 vt "to exhaust"; W VI (I "... to die ...")

def: of dates, bananas, but not mangoes, "to become fully ripe and soft". yom yhamid tyiddhe 2 "when [the dates] reach full ripeness you harvest them".
of dates, bananas, "fully ripe and soft".
ref: W "... extinct ..."; L 2900 "... of a date ..."

def: "may I come in?" The polite inquiry called out when knocking on a door or entering a courtyard. (From hadʔ "peace"?) The reply from within is garrib/garribu! [1280].
ref: Swahili hodi, karibu are borrowings from Omani Arabic.
Jb 817 "to augment"; W "... to throw so. to the ground".

def: "to apply pressure", + ʕale "to something". 1. tehwīs wēgid yāḫuḏ 19* "[drilling concrete] takes a lot of pressing".
"sheep and goats", as opposed to boš "camels".
ref: L 2907 "a large number of men and beasts of carriage ..."

def: "dead leaves/stalks", that get in the way, e.g. of lucerne-crowns or a well-pump foot-valve.
"to get better", from an illness. yithāwen 15 3rd m. s. imp.
"recovered", from an illness. = [899]. ahwan inšallah said on hearing of someone's illness, "I hope you/he gets better [soon]".
[a] n 7* "sunken ground, a hollow". [b] adj muhwenne l-arḍ 1 "the ground is sunken".
ref: [b] W II "... to belittle ..."; L 3046 mahwan "... a dug hollow", under root hwy.

def: [425b] "a pinch", a long iron bar with a chisel-end, used for detaching palm-cuttings from the mother, loosening rocks while digging wells, etc.
of a he-donkey 19; of a he-camel 25*, "noisily to want the female". ḥimār hēyig yrīd yerkab ʕale l-ḥimāra 17 "a noisy donkey, wanting to mount the female".
ref: [128]; W "... to be in great excitement ..."; L 2910.

def: = II. athayyed lak 7 "I'll wait for you".
il-hiyēs 8 [§ 4.6 example 18], pl. -ēt 2,8 "to plough". hisnēhe 25 "we ploughed [the soil]". + ʕale ṯ-ṯor 17 "to plough by bull". passive [§ 4.2 example 1].
of a plant, "to let its leaves wilt and fall". kull šagra yhīf 11 "all plants drop leaves [before high summer]".
"a large drift-net", used all night from one boat.
[a] "where?/where". limhyan tbah ysīr 6 "[the water] goes wherever you want". [b] "here" yšilluh min hayn layn bʕīd 17 "he takes it from here to a great distance".
"next to". inte hina wana meṯelen wil-bǣb 17 "[the same distance as] for example, you here to me by the door".
ref: Wright 2 84 wāw ul-maʕiyya. o/ū is the predominant way in Khābūra to make pet names, e.g. Ḥamdu for Ḥamad, Saʕūd for Saʕīd, ʕAbod for ʕAbdallah, ʕAlo for ʕAli, Ġarūb for Ġarīb, Faṭṭom for Fāṭima, Nāṣor for Nāṣir. cf. Ja 657.

def: of a light, "to shine". il-fener bʕīd wābuṣ 12 "the hurricane-lamp shines a long way".
"to let light through", e.g. of an old roof or a pierced container.
"to be hard-working/energetic". Sayf wubal, yifṣi bisurʕa 11 "Sayf is (lit. was) energetic, he works hard and fast".

ref: R 196 II "to be able"; L 9 root ʔbl stems I, II "to be skilled in the good management of livestock ..."

def: "beholden". il-ḥurma awgab 13* "the wife is wholly concerned [with her husband's welfare]".
=+ bi "to throw something". awugg beh awarrah 11 "'wagg' and 'warr' are synonyms", lit. "I throw it, I throw it".
"to be, be found". fī kill mekēn yetweggid ḥette fī ʕIbri 16 "[the Beni Sʕīd] are found everywhere, even in ʕIbri".
"to hear" a strange/suspicious sound. waggazteh ane 11 "I heard it myself".
[§ 4.6 example 44] "one". kulluh wāḥid 12,21,23 [388] "it's all one", "it makes no difference"; mǣ killuh wǣḥi 22 "they're not all the same"; kem wāḥid? 16* "how many [beams]?"
"to pant". yitwaḥḥel min iš-šems 1 "it's panting because of the sun".

[a] + ʕale 6,11 "to be around for something". mā wuḥt ʕale l-feleg 12 "the conduit [in Khābūra] was before my time". [b] 2 "to have done it's time", e.g. of a rābe 579. [c] * "to have time/the chance". mā tūḥi 30 "you don't have time".
ref: [b] R 234 vt "to get to the end of". [c] Swahili wahi; for wǣḥi see [1669].

def: = I. [a] mā wāḥayt ʕale l-gāzra 9 "the gāzra was before my time". [b] vt mā wāḥaythe 11 "I wasn't around for [the gāzra]". [c] = I [c]. mā wāḥayt 9* "the sun doesn't get the chance to beat down inside [the bound palm-cutting]".
"to do something completely" 11; "in time". ayūkleh huwa ila mā twaḥḥaytuh inte 29 "[the bees] will eat [the honey] if you don't do (extract) it in time".
[a] vi 1,11 "to move out of the way". waḫḫar ʕanni! 17 "out of my way!" = [458a]; [664]. [b] vt 1,19* "to put something to one side; postpone".

"a soaked ḫṣāfe" filled with meat from the slaughtered animal, and spices, and sewn through with palm-leaves to keep it from falling apart, and put into a tennūr-oven (usually below ground) to bake for the ʕīd-meal of mišwi [900].
ref: L 3050 I "to beat and moisten grain ... until it becomes cohesive and fit for food"; H "... a dish of dates and cream", waḫfa "leather-bag".

def: [23b] "a sieve". In Khābūra only mišḫal [816] and minḫal W were heard.
"to leave alone, abandon". mā yweddaru n-naḫīl 8 "[Omanis] won't abandon date-palms".
ref: W "... to waste"; H I "... to discard ..."

def: "goodbye". A variant of the usual famēn illāh.
[1473b] "to take, transport". It can be double transitive like [862].
"a rope", for lowering a basket, e.g. a manfaḍ, from up a palm-tree.
[1665] "to throw at". warr hēḏēk il-kelb bil-ḥaṣa 1 "he threw the stone at the dog over there".
"a low wall around a house's flat roof", to stop children falling off, and give a little privacy.
[1593] "to awaken someone". il-mwarrag 1,26 "the drum-beater" during Ramadan in the old days, who would let people know when to get up and eat saḥūr.
"a front shoulder", of an animal. A back shoulder, i.e. a thigh, is faḫḏ, W.

ref: R 260 II "to roll (of rubble)"; H warwar fi l-kalām "he spoke volubly"; S wirwir "muttering ..."; P warwarāna "... to jabber, mutter".

def: "fertile, fecund", e.g. of a male palm-flower, a he-goat.
"a lungi, a long loin-cloth", worn under the dišdǣše
"to arrange, put something in order". Opposite of [418].
ref: W "to curb ..."; H "... to keep (an army) in battle order".

def: "a brand" (W). On humans for curative purposes, on animals also to show ownership. Some of these tribal ownership-marks are as follows. Yneba have garaʕtayn 27 (two strokes); Whība have a dǣmiʕ (the numeral seven, V) under the eye, a garaʕ on the cheek and/or a dḫayle on the hip 27; Ḥwāsina have a dǣmiʕ with a ruzza (a point) next to or above it 17,23; Beni ʕMar have a zēgil (a noose-shap) on the ear of hoš, and on boš an arqā (the letter dāl) on the hip or under the eye 17,23.
ref: [1091]; [1396] L 913 dumuʕ / dimāʕ "brand below an animal's eye ...", 1074 razza "a single piercing"; H qarʕa "... brand on a camel's thigh ..."

def: "a brander". il-wassēm il-mkawwi 7 "the brander is [also called] 'il-mkawwi'".
"to become thick/fat". hēḏe l-moz mā yūšab 21* "these bananas don't thicken up".
"thickness". ile wešub il-bīb 5 "to the thickness of the pipe".

ref: W wišb "... crowd"; L 2943 wašb "fleshy (of a date)"; H wašb.
R 234 "to plot against"; W wašā bi.

def: "to fill in; line, plaster something". tūṣib yifra 1 "you fill in a hole"; mā kēnet mawṣūba bil-ismint 20 "it wasn't plastered with cement".
"plaster", on a wall 20, "infill", in a wall 17.
"thin", of a branch 5; of a caterpillar 20*. Diminutive [151].
ref: [610]; [1699]; R 71 uṣēm; Jb 873 waṣīm; H "crack, fissure ..."

def: "to lower the date-raceme", a month before ḥidār, without tying it down. Not always done in Khābūra.
ref: W I "... to set sth. down ..."; H "... to lower so."
H I "to put (meat) on a plank for dessication [sic]".

def: = II. šagra mutwaḍḍama 19 "an old worn-out tree".
"to press something down". wuṭāni ʕal-arḍ 1 "he pressed me to the ground"; tūṭāni 1 "you're pressing me down".
ref: [732]; R 206; W waṭiʔa "... to tread on ..."

def: [153a] "below, seawards". Often with prefixed l (= ila?), loṭa 12, / loṭi 10*. il-blǣd il-loṭiyya wen-nǣs illi loṭīk 17 "the settlements down there and the people below you nearer the sea".

[a] n 7* "a pair of sandals". šell waṭītuh 30 "he took his sandals". [b] f. adj. with prefixed l 17 [1709] "low". Thus [c] n. pl. il-lwāṭye 1,12* "the Shiite merchants", living in the seaside-settlement.
ref: [a] R 47 waṭye "sandal", 190 waṭītek "your sandal"; Jb 866 waṭya, pl. waṭāyā, "shoe". [b] W waṭiʔ. [c] [884].

lex: waʕb 3,6,21, pl. wʕūb 13* / waʕāb 8 / waʕǣbe 3 / waʕbǣt 17*
def: "a compacted earthern brim", of a gelbe or irrigation-channel. = [1088].
ref: W X "... to encircle ..."; L 2951 awʔab li "most fit for the full receiving of sth. ..."

def: "to hurt someone in the eye". waġaftni 17 "you poked me in the eye".
"a majority". awfārīt is-sēḥil nḫīl 9 "the coast is predominantly date-palms".
ref: R 66 a superlative form; W I "to abound ..."

def: "a fireplace for cooking", lit. "the fireplace of the cooking-pot" [1037].
"to bundle something up". waggart il-gett ṯlēṯe wugūr 11 "I piled the lucerne into three bundles".

ref: R 43 waqor; W wiqr, pl auqār "heavy load" ..."

def: "a mortar", for a pestle. According to 1 this is a Swayq word for the Khābūran minḥēz [1514].
ref: Jb 853 moqaʔa; W "place where sth. drops ..."

def: "to stand, stop", W. bawqaf minni 11* "I'll stand here"; awqaf! 17 imv. m. "stand still!"; wuqfīh! 17 imv. f. "stop it (the water flow)!" The corresponding classical forms would be aqifu, qif! qifīh!
"to prop something up". tūkib moz ʕan tinkisir 11 "you prop up banana-trees to stop them breaking".
ref: Ḥarsūsi awkōb "to insert, put in"; L 2962 "... to stand erect, be erected, set up ..."

def: "to know well, be sure of". nwikkidhin 23 "we know [our animals] well"; mwekkid 2,12 act.pt. "sure, certain of". = [1658].
"to eat each other". yiddāḫlin baʕḍin baʕḍ uyitwēklin kiḏa 29 "the [bees] interlock (W) and eat each other thus".
ref: [1377]; R 410; W taʔākala "... to be devoured ..."

def: of animals, but not of humans (W), "to give birth [to]". miṯil ʕanz weldit 12 "for example [when] a goat has given birth"; kēn šē tūlid 29 "if a goat gives birth"; mʕind wildhin 29 "when [goats] are giving birth". Of humans the verb is waḍaʕat, tūḍaʕ, W.
